</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 9.40.56 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 9.43.25 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 9.43.47 AM.png"">"							"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.56.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.57.00 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.57.17 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-forearm/approach/dorsal-approach"">AO: Dorsal Approach to Distal Forearm</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::Dorsal_ForearmWristCarpus"
According to <b>AO</b>, what is the <b>Definition</b> of <b><i>Healing</i></b>? When is it <b>Complete</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Returning to PREINJURY Condition. Bone healing is regarded as Complete when Bone has <u>Regained Normal Stiffness and Strength</u>.}}											"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
According to <b>AO</b>, what is the <b>Definition</b> of&nbsp;<strong><i>Callus</i></strong>?<strong>&nbsp;<br></strong><br>{{c1::Tissue of <u>Immature Bone and Cartilage</u> that is Formed at the <u>Site of Bony Repair</u> to <u>BRIDGE a Fracture</u>}}											"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
"According to <b>AO</b>, what is the <b>Definition</b> of a&nbsp;<strong>Graft?</strong><span style=""color: rgb(87, 87, 89);"">&nbsp;<br><br></span>{{c1::Tissue or substance that is Placed at a Site <u>Different from its Site of Origin</u>&nbsp;}}"											"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
"What is the <b>Definition</b> of&nbsp;<strong>Osteoconduction?</strong><span style=""color: rgb(87, 87, 89);"">&nbsp;<br><br></span>{{c1::Ability of a Material to Act as a <u>Scaffold</u> for the <u>Attachment of Osteogenic Cells</u>}}"	<strong>Osteogenic cells:</strong>&nbsp;Osteogenic cells must be present either within the graft (autograft), transplanted into the graft during surgery (bone marrow aspiration), or able to migrate into the graft from surrounding tissue (adjacent bone, periosteum, muscle, fat, or connective tissue).&nbsp;										"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
What is&nbsp;<strong>Osteoinduction?</strong>&nbsp;<br><br>{{c1::Biological stimuli from Growth factors and Cytokines are used to <u>Stimulate Osteoblastic Progenitor Cells</u> to Proliferate and Differentiate <u>into Bone</u>.&nbsp;}}	ex.)&nbsp;<b>BMP, TGF-β, IGF, PDGF</b>										"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
<b>{{c1::Cortical</b><b>}}</b><b>&nbsp;(Autograft)</b>&nbsp;is often the <b>Allograft</b> that is used for its <b>Mechanical Strength</b>. It shows <b>{{c2::Slow}} Incorporation</b> but has <b>{{c2::Good}} Structural Integrity</b>.											"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
<b>{{c1::Cancellous}}&nbsp;</b><strong>(Autograft) </strong>is the&nbsp;<b>Graft</b> used when <b>Structural Support </b>is <b>NOT</b> as Important as the <b>Good Osteoinductive</b> and <b>Excellent Osteoconductive</b>&nbsp;Potential. It shows <b>{{c2::Rapid}} Incorporation</b>.&nbsp;											"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
<b>Pros </b>of <b>Freeze-Dried </b>vs. <b>Fresh Frozen </b>Allograft:<br><br><b>Freeze-Drying:&nbsp;</b>{{c1::Allows a <u>Long Storage Life</u> and <u>Decreased Antigenicity</u> at the EXPENSE of Mechanical Strength}}<br><br><b>Fresh-Frozen:&nbsp;</b>{{c1::Maintains its Strength and Preserves BMP}}											"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
<div>What is&nbsp;<b>Demineralized Bone Matrix (DBM)</b>?<br><br>{{c1::What is left when the Bone Mineral is Extracted from the Bone by ACIDS. It is made up of <u>Collagen</u>, various <u>Proteins</u>, and <u>Growth Factors</u> (eg BMP).}}</div>	It is generally used as <b>Graft Extenders </b>and has <b>Good Osteoinductive capacity</b>.&nbsp;										"#Ortho::AO::Start::BasicMechanics_FxHealing::BoneHealing"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Position</b>&nbsp;of the Patient during the <b>Volar Approach</b> to the <b>Carpal Tunnel</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::The Arm is in <u>Supination</u> on a Hand Table, with <u>Slight Extension</u>}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<b>Exsanguinate</b> the <b>Arm</b> and <b>Elevate</b> the <b>Tourniquet</b>, if Indicated&nbsp;<br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.02.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.02.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.34 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.07.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.04 PM.png"">"		"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.59.39 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.58.15 PM.png"">"			"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::CarpalTunnel"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision&nbsp;</b>for the&nbsp;<b>Volar Approach</b> to the <b>Carpal Tunnel</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.18 PM.png"">}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.02.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.34 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.07.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.04 PM.png"">"		"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.59.39 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.58.15 PM.png"">"			"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::CarpalTunnel"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar Approach</b> to the <b>Carpal Tunnel</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>
1. Incise</b> <b>{{c1::Skin}}</b> and <b>{{c1::Subcutaneous Tissue}}</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c1::Palmar Fascia}}</b></div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

<div><b>2. Incise</b> the <b>{{c2::Palmar Fascia}}</b> and <b>Retract</b> it to<b> Expose </b>the <b>{{c2::TCL&nbsp;}}</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.34 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.02.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.34 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.07.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.04 PM.png"">"		"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.59.39 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.58.15 PM.png"">"			"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::CarpalTunnel"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar Approach</b> to the <b>Carpal Tunnel</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>
1.&nbsp;</b>A <b>Small, Sharp Incision</b> is made in the <b>Distal </b>Aspect of the <b>TCL</b></div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
- <b>Protect</b> the <b>{{c1::Superficial Palmar Arch::Vascular Structure}}</b><br>
- <b>Stay in line</b> with the <b>{{c2::Radial}} Aspect </b>of the <b>{{c2::Ring}} Finger</b> to <b>Avoid Injury</b> to the <b>Recurrent Motor Branch<br>2.&nbsp;Slide</b> the <b>Elevator</b> into the {{c3::<b>Carpal Tunnel</b>}} <b>Beneath</b> the {{c3::<b>TCL</b>}} to <b>Protect</b> the <b>Underlying Median
nerve</b><br><b>3. Sharply Incise</b> the <b>Ligament</b> while Staying on <b>Top</b> of the <b>Elevator</b> to Expose the {{c4::Median Nerve}}
and {{c4::Flexor Tendons}}<br><b>4.</b> Using <b>Scissors</b> with <b>Tips Pointed</b> <b>{{c5::Ulnarly}}</b> to <b>Protect</b> the <b>Median n.</b>, continue <b>Cutting</b> the <b>TCL&nbsp;</b><b>{{c5::</b><b>Distal</b><b>}}&nbsp;</b>to&nbsp;<b>{{c5::</b><b>Proximal</b><b>}}</b>, then&nbsp;<b>{{c5::</b><b>Distally</b><b>}}</b></div><div><b>5. Visualize </b>the {{c6::<b>Recurrent Motor Br.</b>&nbsp;of the <b>Median n.</b>}}&nbsp;as it Enters the <b>Thenar Musculature</b>
and {{c6::<b>Superficial Palmar Arch</b>}} to confirm that they are <b>Intact&nbsp;</b></div></div></div>
</div></div><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.04 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.02.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.34 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.07.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.04 PM.png"">"		"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.59.39 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.58.15 PM.png"">"			"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::CarpalTunnel"
"<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>The <b>Recurrent</b> <b>Motor</b> Branch of the <b>Median</b> nerve has a <b>Variable</b> course:<br><br>{{c1::80}}% branches <b>Extraligamentously</b> and is <b>Recurrent</b><br>{{c1::15}}% branches <b>Subligamentously</b><br>{{c1::5}}% branches <b>Transligamentously&nbsp;</b></div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Position</b>&nbsp;of the Patient during&nbsp;the <b>Anterolateral </b>Approach to the <b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Supine with use of an Arm Board}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"The <b>Opposite Arm, Legs</b>, and <b>Bony Prominences</b> are <b>Padded</b> and <b>Protected</b><br>A <b>Bump</b> may be helpful<br>A <b>Sterile Tourniquet</b> may be useful&nbsp;<br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM.png"">"							"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.25.10 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision&nbsp;</b>for the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral </b>Approach to the <b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::An <u>8-12 cm</u> incision is made along the <u>Lateral Border of the Biceps</u>, From Distal Interval b/w <u>Mobile Wad &amp; Biceps</u> to <u>Deltopectoral</u> Interval Proximally}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.27.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM-e96b5d9076efcb0154ff121680fb18aa5276346e.png"">"							"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.25.10 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the <b>Anterolateral </b>Approach to the <b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div><b>1. Incise</b> the <b>Fascia</b> carefully <b>b/w</b> the <b>{{c1::Biceps/Brachialis}}</b> and <b>{{c1::Mobile Wad}}</b> and <b>Extend Proximally</b></div><div><b>2.&nbsp;</b>Look for the <b>{{c2::LABC::nerve}}</b> crossing <b>Distally</b>. The <b>{{c2::Radial n.::nerve}}</b> is <b>Deeper</b>. Identify the <b>nerve</b> in the <b>Interval b/w Biceps</b> and the <b>Mobile Wad</b> and <b>follow Proximally</b> as the Incision is Developed.</div><div><b>3.&nbsp;</b>Proximally, look for the <b>{{c3::Cephalic Vein::Vasculature}}</b> in the <b>{{c3::Deltopectoral Interval}}</b>. If it is <b>Retracted</b> with the <b>Deltoid</b>, <b>Muscular Tributaries</b> are <b>LESS Likely</b> to be <b>Torn</b><br><b>4.&nbsp;</b>Retract the <b>{{c4::Biceps}} Medially</b>, and the <b>{{c4::Mobile Wad}} Laterally</b> to Identify the <b>Radial n</b>. The <b>{{c4::Brachialis::Muscle}}</b> is now <b>Exposed</b></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.36.41 PM.png"">"						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 10.24.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 10.25.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 10.25.31 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 10.25.46 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 10.26.00 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.25.10 PM.png""><br>"	"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral"
"The <b>Radial nerve</b> enters the <b>Anterior Compartment </b>of the <b>ARM</b> by <b>Perforating</b> the {{c1::Lateral Intermuscular Septum}}<br><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"The use of <b>Hohmann Retractors </b>in the <b>Distal 2/5 </b>of the <b>Humerus</b> carries a <b>High Risk </b>of <b>Iatrogenic nerve injury</b> and should therefore be <b>AVOIDED.</b><br><img src=""12_a040_i160.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 6.35.10 PM.png"">"				"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.38.03 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.38.21 PM.png"">"			"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.25.10 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div><b>1.&nbsp;Dissect</b>&nbsp;the <b>Brachialis</b>&nbsp;within the <b>Neurovascular Plane </b>b/w the <b>{{c1::Radial n.}}</b> and <b>{{c1::Musculocutaneous n.}}</b> to maintain <b>Innervation</b> to the <b>Brachialis</b>, OR <b>Retract </b>the <b>Brachialis</b> <b>{{c1::MEDIALLY}}<br>- </b>BEWARE <b>Medial Retraction</b> <b>Damages</b> the <b>{{c2::Radial n.}}</b> <b>Branch</b> to the <b>Brachialis<br>2.&nbsp;</b>If <b>Necessary</b>, <b>Release</b> some of the <b>Brachialis Attachment Proximally</b> to allow the <b>Plate</b> to <b>Lie</b> on the <b>Bone</b>.</div><div><b>Extend</b> the <b>Dissection Proximally</b>, as needed, to the <b>Anterior Border</b> of the <b>Deltoid</b> and along the <b>Deltopectoral interval</b><br><b>3.&nbsp;</b>To <b>Access</b> the <b>Proximal Humerus</b>, <b>Partially Release</b> the <b>{{c3::Deltoid}} Insertion Anteriorly</b>, if necessary, and <b>Retract&nbsp;{{c3::Laterally}}<br>4. </b>To Access the <b>Distal Humerus, Mobilize </b>the<b>&nbsp;{{c4::Radial n.}}</b>&nbsp;as needed and <b>Follow</b> to the <b>Point </b>where it <b>Passes </b>through the&nbsp;<b>{{c4::Lateral Intermuscular Septum}}</b></div><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.38.03 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.38.21 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.01 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.24.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 1.25.10 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral"
What <b>Location</b> of <b>Humerus Shaft Fractures</b> Generally Use the <b>Anterior (Brachialis Split) </b>Approach?<br><br>{{c1::Middle 1/3}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 9.02.04 AM.png""><br><img src=""12_a040_i150.png"">"								"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1016/humeral-shaft-fractures"">Orthobullets: Humeral Shaft Fractures</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral #Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::UpperExtremity::Humerus::Shaft"
What <b>Location</b> of <b>Humerus Shaft Fractures</b> Generally Use the <b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach?<br><br>{{c1::Proximal 1/3 to Middle 1/3}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 9.00.18 AM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/humerus-fracture-repair-anterolateral-approach/"">VuMedi: Humerus Fracture Repair - Anterolateral Approach</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1016/humeral-shaft-fractures"">Orthobullets: Humeral Shaft Fractures</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-humerus-after-henry"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Anterolateral #Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::UpperExtremity::Humerus::Shaft"
What <b>Location</b> of <b>Humerus Shaft Fractures</b> Generally Use the <b>Posterior&nbsp;</b>Approach?<br><br>{{c1::Middle to Distal 1/3}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-24 at 2.24.14 PM.png""><br><iframe width=""560"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/9NbF2ruhqhA"" title=""YouTube video player"" frameborder=""0"" allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe>"								"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1016/humeral-shaft-fractures"">Orthobullets: Humeral Shaft Fractures</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::UpperExtremity::Humerus::Shaft"
"What are the&nbsp;<b>Positions</b>&nbsp;of the Patient that can be used during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<u>PRONE</u> with the <u>Arm ABducted 90<sup>o</sup></u>, <u>Sandbag</u> placed Under the Shoulder of the Operative side, Elbow Allowed to Bend
and the <u>Forearm to Hang Over the side</u> of the Table}}<br><br>{{c1::LATERAL}}<br></div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 11.31.22 AM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision&nbsp;</b>for the&nbsp;<b>Posterior&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Proximally in Straight Line from Olecranon to ~8 cm Below Acromion, in MIDLINE of Posterior Arm}}<br></div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 11.37.14 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 11.38.05 AM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior (Tricep-Split)&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1.&nbsp;</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>Incise</b> the&nbsp;</span>{{c1::<b>Deep Fascia</b> of the <b>Arm</b>}}<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;in <b>Line</b> with the <b>Skin Incision&nbsp;<br></b></span><b>2. Identify</b>&nbsp;the <b>Gap</b> b/w the <b>{{c2::Lateral}}</b> and <b>{{c2::Long}} Heads </b>of the <b>Triceps</b> with <b>Blunt</b> Dissection <b>Proximal </b>to <b>Distal</b>, <b>Retracting</b> the&nbsp;<b>{{c2::Lateral}}&nbsp;</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">Head <b>Laterally</b> and the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Long}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;Head <b>Medially&nbsp;</b></span></div><div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>3.&nbsp;</b></span><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>Distally</b>, the Muscle will need to be <b>Divided</b> by <b>Sharp Dissection</b> along the <b>Line</b> of the <b>Skin Incision</b>. Many small <b>Blood Vessels cross</b> the Muscle at this Level; these need to be <b>Coagulated Individually</b>.&nbsp;</span></div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 11.42.41 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 11.43.03 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 11.52.25 AM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior&nbsp;</b><b>(Tricep-Split)&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1.&nbsp;</b><b>Identify</b>&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Radial&nbsp;</b>n. &amp; Accompanying&nbsp;<b>{{c1::Profunda Brachii}} artery </b>Within the {{c1::<b>Spiral Groove</b>}} just <b>Proximal</b> to the <b>{{c1::Medial}}&nbsp;Head</b>.</div><div><b>2.&nbsp;</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>Incise</b> the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Medial}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>&nbsp;Head</b> in the <b>Midline</b>, continuing the <b>Dissection</b> down to the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Periosteum}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;of the Humerus&nbsp;</span></div><div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>3.&nbsp;</b></span><b>Release</b> the <b>{{c3::Lateral}} </b>Head from the Humerus <b>Proximally</b>, and <b>Incise</b> it <b>Distally</b>, in <b>Line</b> with the Humeral <b>Shaft</b>.<br><b>- Release </b>as <b>LITTLE</b> from <b>Bone</b> as Possible to protect the&nbsp;<b>{{c4::</b><b>Ulnar}} </b>n.<b> Medially</b>, as it is <b>Constrained</b> at point where it passes <b>Distally through</b> the <b>{{c4::Medial Intermuscular Septum}}</b>,<b>&nbsp;</b>from <b>Anterior</b> to <b>Posterior </b>Compartments</div><div><b>4.&nbsp;Release</b> the <b>{{c5::Medial}}</b> Head <b>Proximally</b> until the <b>{{c5::Axillary}} n.</b> is found</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 12.10.21 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior (Tricep-Sparing)&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div><div><div><div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>Incise</b>&nbsp;the&nbsp;</span>{{c1::<b>Deep Fascia</b>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<b>Arm</b>}}<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;in&nbsp;<b>Line</b>&nbsp;with the&nbsp;<b>Skin Incision&nbsp;</b></span></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div></div>"									"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
"How do you <b>Develop</b> the <b>Ulnar Window&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior (Tricep-Sparing)&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div><div><div><div><font color=""#0a0905""><b>1. I</b></font><b>dentify</b> and <b>Mobilize </b>the <b>{{c1::Ulnar}} n</b>. It may be helpful to <b>Protect</b> it with a <b>{{c1::Vessel Loop}}<br>2. Proximally, </b>Follow the <b>nerve</b> along its <b>Course</b> on the <b>{{c2::Medial Intermuscular Septum}}<br>3. Mobilize</b> the <b>Triceps</b> and <b>Retract</b> it <b>{{c3::Laterally}}</b>. This may be achieved by <b>Bluntly Dissecting</b> the <b>{{c3::Medial}} Head</b> from the <b>{{c3::Posterior}} Aspect</b> of the <b>Humerus</b></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 12.29.09 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
"How do you <b>Develop</b> the <b>Radial&nbsp;Window&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior (Tricep-Sparing)&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>?<br><br><div><div><div><div><font color=""#0a0905""><b>1.&nbsp;</b></font><b>Split </b>the <b>{{c1::Triceps Fascia}}</b> and <b>Mobilize</b> the <b>Lateral</b> Head from the <b>{{c1::Lateral Intermuscular Septum}}</b> and <b>Humerus</b> Towards the <b>{{c1::Ulnar}}</b>&nbsp;<b>side</b>.<br><b>2.</b>&nbsp;The <b>Radial n.</b> can be <b>Detected</b> at its <b>Penetration</b> through the&nbsp;<b>{{c2::Lateral Intermuscular Septum}}</b>&nbsp;and followed <b>Upwards</b> in the <b>{{c2::Radial Groove}}</b></div></div></div></div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 12.48.54 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
What are the<b> Main Advantages</b> of the&nbsp;<b>Posterior Tricep-Sparing&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Humerus</b>&nbsp;compared to the <b>Triceps Splitting </b>Approach?<br><br>{{c1::Retains the <u>Musculotendinous Integrity</u> of the Triceps}}<br>{{c1::Allows more <u>Rapid Postoperative Rehabilitation</u>}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-25 at 12.55.00 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-sparing-approach-triceps-on"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Sparing Approach (Triceps-On) to the Humeral Shaft</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/humeral-shaft/approach/posterior-triceps-split-approach"">AO: Posterior Triceps-Split Approach to the Humeral Shaft</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Arm::Posterior"
What are <b>3 Signs</b> of <b>PIN Neuropathy</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Radial Deviation of Hand with Wrist Extension<br>Weakness of Thumb Extension<br>Weakness of MCP Extension}}									"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1024/monteggia-fractures"">Orthobullets: Monteggia Fractures</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::UpperExtremity::Forearm::Monteggia"

"<div>What is the <span style=""font-weight: 700;"">Incidence</span> of <span style=""font-weight: 700;"">PIN Neuropathy</span> with&nbsp;<b>Monteggia</b> Fractures?<br><br>{{c1::Up to 10% in Acute Injuries}}</div>"	"<img class=""resizer"" src=""1kY4wZ-UC4V56zrEOicAWqQ.png"">"								"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1024/monteggia-fractures"">Orthobullets: Monteggia Fractures</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::UpperExtremity::Forearm::Monteggia"
"What are the&nbsp;<b>Indications</b>&nbsp;to use the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::ORIF of Radial Shaft fractures (<u>Middle and Distal</u>)}}<br>{{c1::Exposure of <u>Tumors</u> and Forearm Masses}}<br>{{c1::Debridement of Radial Shaft <u>Osteomyelitis</u>}}<br></div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>POSITION</b>&nbsp;of the Patient when using&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Supine and the Arm is Supine on Hand Table<br>Exsanguinate the limb and Elevate the Tourniquet}}<br></div>

</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.50.23 PM.png"">"				"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.51.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.35.53 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.16 PM.png"">"			"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.54.18 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/anterior-approach-henry#introduction"">AO: Volar Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
What are the&nbsp;<b>Anatomic Landmarks&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><b>Proximally</b>: {{c1::Biceps Tendon, which Crosses the Front of the Elbow Joint, Medial to the Brachioradialis muscle}}<br><b>Distally</b>: {{c1::Radial Styloid process}}	"<a href=""https://www.acumed.net/video/anatomic-midshaft-forearm-plating-system-radius-plate-volar-approach-with-dr-richard/"">Acumed: Volar Henry Forearm Shaft</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.53.52 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.51.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.35.53 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.16 PM.png"">"		"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.54.18 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/anterior-approach-henry#introduction"">AO: Volar Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
"Where is the <b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Mark the <u>Radial Styloid</u> and&nbsp;<u>Lateral Aspect of the Biceps</u> Tendon and Draw a <u>Line along the Brachioradialis</u> along these 2 Points}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<div><b>Adjust </b>the Incision <b>Length</b> based on which<b> Structures</b> require <b>Exposure </b>or which <b>Portion</b> of the <b>Radial Shaft </b>needs to be <b>Exposed&nbsp;<br></b><a href=""https://www.acumed.net/video/anatomic-midshaft-forearm-plating-system-radius-plate-volar-approach-with-dr-richard/"">Acumed: Volar Henry Forearm Shaft</a><b><br></b><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.57.03 PM.png""><b><br></b></div>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.51.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.35.53 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.16 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.29.24 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.54.18 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/anterior-approach-henry#introduction"">AO: Volar Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1. Incise</b> the <b>{{c1::Skin}}</b> and <b>{{c1::Subcutaneous Tissues}}</b>; avoid the <b>{{c1::LABC::NV structure}} </b>as it
runs on the <b>Anterolateral Forearm</b></div>
<div><b>2. Identify</b> the <b>{{c2::Brachioradialis}} muscle</b> and <b>Bluntly</b> find the <b>Interval</b> between it and the <b>{{c2::FCR}}</b><br><b>3. Identify</b> the <b>{{c3::Superficial Radial n.}}</b> and <b>{{c3::Radial Artery}}</b> Directly <b>Beneath</b> the <b>Brachioradialis&nbsp;</b></div><div><b>4. Divide</b> the <b>Fascia</b> based on the <b>Level</b> of <b>Exposure</b> Required of the <b>Radial Shaft</b><br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<a href=""https://www.acumed.net/video/anatomic-midshaft-forearm-plating-system-radius-plate-volar-approach-with-dr-richard/"">Acumed: Volar Henry Forearm Shaft</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 7.04.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 7.04.43 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.51.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.35.53 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.16 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.29.24 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.54.18 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/anterior-approach-henry#introduction"">AO: Volar Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the <b><u>MIDDLE 1/3</u></b> of the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1.&nbsp;Dissection</b> is continued <b>Between</b> the {{c1::<b>Radial</b> artery}} and <b>{{c1::Brachioradialis}}</b>, retracting the {{c1::<b>FCR</b> Tendon}} <b>Ulnarly</b></div><div><div><div><div><b>2. Identify</b> the <b>{{c2::Pronator Teres}} </b>and <b><u>Pronate</u></b> the <b>Forearm</b> to <b>Identify</b> its <b>Insertion</b> onto the <b>Lateral</b>&nbsp;Aspect of the <b>Radius</b></div>
<div>- The <b>Origin </b>of the {{c2::<b>FDS</b>}} also can be Identified just <b>Anterior</b> to this area on the <b>Radius </b><br><b>3. Incise</b> the <b>Insertion Point</b> of the <b>{{c3::Pronator Teres}}</b> <b>Subperiosteally
</b></div>
<div>- <b>Part </b>of the <b>{{c3::FDS}}</b> <b>Muscle Origin</b> also is <b>Incised</b><br>
- <b>Retract</b> the <b>{{c4::Pronator Teres}}</b> <b>Radially</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Middle 1/3 </b>of the <b>Radial Shaft</b><br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<a href=""https://www.acumed.net/video/anatomic-midshaft-forearm-plating-system-radius-plate-volar-approach-with-dr-richard/"">Acumed: Volar Henry Forearm Shaft</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 7.13.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 7.13.25 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.51.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.35.53 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.16 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.29.24 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.54.18 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/anterior-approach-henry#introduction"">AO: Volar Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe width=""560"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" frameborder=""0"" allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar (Henry) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b><u>PROXIMAL 1/3</u></b>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div><b>1.&nbsp;</b>The <b>{{c1::Supinator}}</b> muscle covers the <b>{{c1::Lateral}} Aspect</b> of the <b>Proximal Radius</b>. The <b>PIN</b> lies <b>within</b> the <b>Substance</b> of this <b>Muscle</b>. <br><b>2. </b>The <b>Forearm</b> should be <b>Fully {{c2::Supinated}}</b> to <b>Displace</b> the <b>PIN</b> away from the <b>Surgical Field</b>.<br><b>3. </b>The <b>Supinator</b> Muscle is then <b>Incised </b>along its <b>Most</b> <b>{{c3::Medial}}</b> <b>Edge</b>, and <b>Gently Elevated</b> from the <b>Bone Surface</b> only to the Extent that it is <b>Necessary</b> for the <b>Required Exposure</b>. <br></div>	"In <b>ORIF</b>, the Plate is <b>Inserted DEEP</b>&nbsp;to the Elevated <b>Supinator </b>Muscle<br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-01 at 9.12.50 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-30 at 6.51.04 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.35.53 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.16 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.29.24 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.54.18 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/anterior-approach-henry#introduction"">AO: Volar Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
"What are the&nbsp;<b>Indications</b>&nbsp;to use the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>

</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.21.59 AM.png"">"						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.31.33 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What are the&nbsp;<b>Anatomic Landmarks&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>

<div>{{c1::Lateral Epicondyle of Humerus}}<br>{{c1::Lister Tubercle}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.25.22 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.24.53 AM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.21.59 AM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.31.33 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>POSITION</b>&nbsp;of the Patient when using&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<u>Supine</u> on Table, with the Arm on an Armboard. <u>Pronate</u> the patient’s Arm to <u>Expose the Extensor Compartment</u>}}<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><br><br>OR<br><br></span>{{c1::P<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">lace the Patient’s <u>Arm Across the Chest</u> to <u>Expose Extensor Compartment</u></span>}}</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.31.49 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.21.59 AM.png"">"							"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What is the <b>INTERVAL </b>used<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Between the ECRB and EDC (both innervated by the PIN)}}<br></div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.47.45 AM.png"">"							"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1.</b> Incise <b>Skin</b> and <b>Subcutaneous Tissues</b><br><b>2.</b> <b>Identify </b>the <b>{{c1::ECRB}}</b> and <b>{{c1::EDC}}</b> and <b>Incise</b> {{c1::the <b>Fascia</b>}} at this <b>Interval</b></div><div><b>3. Retract</b> these <b>Muscles</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c2::Supinator}} </b>and <b>{{c2::APL}}</b>; use <b>Caution</b> and <b>Identify</b> the <b>PIN </b>as it <b>Exits</b> the <b>{{c2::Supinator}}</b> and continues <b>Distally </b>in the <b>Forearm</b> on <b>TOP</b> of the <b>{{c2::APL}}</b></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.50.12 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.52.50 AM.png"">"						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.31.33 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the<b> PROXIMAL</b>&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1. Identify </b>the<b>&nbsp;{{c1::PIN}}</b> as it exits the <b>Supinator </b>(<b>{{c1::1 cm::Distance}}&nbsp;Distal </b>to the <b>Muscle Bell</b>y) and carefully <b>Divide</b> the <b>Supinator </b>from <u><b>Distal</b> to <b>Proximal</b></u>, carefully <b>Visualizing</b> and <b>Protecting</b> the {{c1::<b>PIN</b>}} at all
times</div><div>
- Be careful to <b>Identify</b> <b>{{c2::Distal}}</b>&nbsp;<b>Branches</b>, and <b>Visualize</b> and <b>Protect</b> these at all times<br>- If the <b>PIN</b> is <b>Difficult</b> to <b>Identify Distally</b>, it can be located <b>Proximally</b> as it <b>Enters </b>the <b>{{c2::Supinator}}</b>, and the <b>Muscle Belly</b> can be <b>Divided</b> in a {{c2::<b>Proximal</b> to <b>Distal</b>}}<b>&nbsp;fashion</b></div><div><b>2. Fully Supinate</b> the <b>Forearm</b> and <b>Identify</b> the {{c3::<b>Supinator</b>}} on the {{c3::<b>Anterior</b>}}&nbsp;<b>Surface</b> of the <b>Radius</b></div>
<div><b>3. Subperiosteally Strip</b> the {{c4::<b>Supinator</b>}}&nbsp;<b>muscle</b> from the <b>Radius</b> and <b>Reflect</b> it to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Proximal Radius&nbsp;</b><br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.52.50 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.54.05 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-02 at 10.54.29 AM.png"">"						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.31.33 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the<b>&nbsp;MIDDLE</b>&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div><div><b>1.&nbsp;</b>After <b>Visualization</b> of the <b>PIN</b> and its <b><u>Distal</u> Branches</b>, <b>Identify</b> the <b>{{c1::APL}}</b> and <b>{{c1::EPB::Muscles}}
</b><br><b>2. Subperiosteally Free</b> the <b>{{c2::Superior}} Border</b> of the&nbsp;<b>{{c1::APL}}</b>&nbsp;and the <b>{{c2::Inferior}} Border</b> of the&nbsp;<b>{{c1::EPB::Muscles}}</b>&nbsp;from the <b>Radius</b> and <b>Retract</b> these Muscles to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Middle 1/3</b> of the <b>Radius&nbsp;</b></div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.41.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.42.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 4.54.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png"">"						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.31.33 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the<b>&nbsp;DISTAL</b>&nbsp;<b>Dorsal (Thompson) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm</b>?<br><br><div><div><b>1.&nbsp;</b><b>Subperiosteally Dissect</b> the <b>Interval</b>&nbsp;Between the <b>{{c1::ECRB}}</b> and <b>{{c1::EDC}} Distally
</b><br><b>2. Retract </b>to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Distal 1/3</b> of the <b>Radius</b></div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.45.13 PM.png""><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.00.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.51.51 PM.png"">"							"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 3.52.39 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/posterolateral-approach-thompson#introduction"">AO: Dorsal Thompson Approach</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::DorsalThompson"
"What are the&nbsp;<b>Indications</b>&nbsp;to use the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::ORIF of Ulna Shaft Fractures}}<br>{{c1::Tumor or Forearm Mass Excision}}<br>{{c1::Ulnar Osteotomy&nbsp;}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.06.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/approach-to-the-ulna"">AO: Approach to the Ulna</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::UlnarShaft"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>POSITION</b>&nbsp;of the Patient when using&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<u>Supine</u> on the Table, with the <u>Arm in Pronation Across the Patient’s Body</u><br>Exsanguinate the limb and elevate the tourniquet}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.15.22 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.15.45 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.12.40 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.06.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/approach-to-the-ulna"">AO: Approach to the Ulna</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::UlnarShaft"
"What are the <b>Landmarks</b>&nbsp;when using&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">The <u>S</u></span><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><u>ubcutaneous Border of the Ulna</u></span><span style=""font-weight: 700; color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""> </span><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">can be Palpated along its <u>Entire Length</u></span>}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">It is <b>Felt most Easily</b> in the <b>Proximal</b> and <b>Distal Thirds</b> of the Bone.&nbsp;<br><br></span><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.17.10 PM.png""><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><br></span>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.06.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/approach-to-the-ulna"">AO: Approach to the Ulna</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::UlnarShaft"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<u>Linear</u> Incision along the <u>Posterior Ulnar Shaft</u> - Center <u>over the Fracture</u> when Present}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>Length</b> of Incision Depends on
<b>how much Exposure</b> is needed<br>Can <b>Access</b> the Ulna from the <b>Olecranon Tip</b> to the <b>Ulnar Styloid</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><br></span><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.17.10 PM.png""><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><br></span><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.18.37 PM.png""><br>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.06.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.18.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/approach-to-the-ulna"">AO: Approach to the Ulna</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::UlnarShaft"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1. Incise Skin</b> and <b>Subcutaneous Tissues</b><br><b>2. Define</b> the <b>Interval</b> between the {{c1::ECU}} (<b>Innervated</b> by the {{c1::PIN}}) and the {{c1::FCU}} (<b>Innervated</b> by the {{c1::Ulnar nerve}})&nbsp;</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png""><br></div></div></div></div>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.06.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.18.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/approach-to-the-ulna"">AO: Approach to the Ulna</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::UlnarShaft"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>Expose </b>the <b>Ulnar Shaft </b>by <b>Retracting</b> the <b>ECU </b>and <b>FCU</b>, and <b>Widen Exposure</b> by <b>Stripping&nbsp;</b>{{c1::<b>Muscles</b>}} from the <b>Ulna Shaft Periosteally</b> to <b>Protect</b> the <b>Ulnar</b> nerve <b>Lying&nbsp;</b>{{c1::<b>Volar</b>}} to {{c1::<b>FDP</b>}}&nbsp;<b>muscle&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"
<div>
<div><div><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png""><br></div></div></div>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.06.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.18.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.10.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-03 at 5.07.23 PM.png"">"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 5.56.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-05 at 5.06.15 PM.png"">"		"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/forearm-shaft/approach/approach-to-the-ulna"">AO: Approach to the Ulna</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::UlnarShaft"
"What are the <b>Main Hazards&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar Shaft</b>, and How do you <b>Protect </b>them?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::ULNAR <b>Nerve</b> &amp; <b>Artery</b>}}<br></div>
<div>{{c2::Take care to <b>Strip FCU muscle</b> off the Ulna in a <b>Subperiosteal fashion</b> to <b>Avoid Injury</b> to these
structures&nbsp;}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>

"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Kocher Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow</b>?<br><br><div>

"What are the&nbsp;<b>Anatomic Landmarks&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Kocher Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Lateral Epicondyle<br>Radial Head<br>Olecranon}}</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Kocher Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Skin and Subcutaneous Dissection to Expose the Fascia Overlying the <u>Anconeus and ECU</u>}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Kocher Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1. </b>The <b>Interval</b> is between the <b>{{c1::ECU}}</b> (<b>Innerv. {{c2::PIN}}</b>) and <b>{{c1::Anconeus}}</b> (<b>Innerv.</b> {{c2::<b>Radial</b> n.}}); <b>Divide</b> the <b>Fascia between</b> these Muscles and <b>Split</b> this <b>Interval Bluntly</b>
to <b>Expose </b>the <b>Underlying {{c1::Annular Ligament}} </b>and <b>{{c1::Joint Capsule}}
</b></div>
<div><b>2.&nbsp;Keep</b> the <b>Forearm {{c3::Pronated}}</b> to protect the <b>PIN</b><br><b>3. Divide</b> the <b>{{c4::Capsule}}</b> and <b>{{c4::Annular</b> Ligament<b>}} Longitudinally</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c4::Radiocapitellar}} Joint</b><br><b>4. Limit Distal Dissection</b> to the <b>Distal Extent</b> of the <b>{{c5::Annular Ligament}}</b> to <b>Avoid Injuring</b> the<b> PIN&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.21.21 PM.png""><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.41.23 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.41.46 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.39.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.39.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.40.36 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.40.59 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.41.23 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.41.46 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.42.09 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.42.30 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/kocher-approach-to-the-elbow/"">VuMedi: Kocher Approach to the Elbow</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-forearm/approach/lateral-approach"">AO: Kaplan and Kocher Approaches to the Lateral Elbow</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::Kocher"
"How can the&nbsp;<b>Kocher Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow </b>be<b> Extended Proximally</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1.</b> Performed <b>Along</b> the <b>{{c1::Lateral Supracondylar Ridge}}</b> with <b>Subperiosteal Exposure</b> of the <b>{{c1::Anterior}} Humerus </b>and <b>{{c1::Lateral}} Column&nbsp;<br></b><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>2.</b> Place the <b>Retractor Underneath</b> the <b>{{c2::Brachialis}}</b> to <b>Protect </b>the <b>{{c2::Radial}} nerve</b><br><b>-&nbsp; {{c3::Lateral Collateral Ligament}} Reconstructions</b> and <b>ORIF </b>of the <b>{{c3::Distal Humerus}}</b> and <b>{{c3::Lateral Column}} Fractures</b> can be Performed with this <b>Proximal Extension</b></div><div><b>3. Distal Extension</b> is <b>Limited</b> by the <b>{{c4::PIN}}</b>, and <b>Dissection</b> should be <b>Limited</b> to the <b>Level </b>of the <b>{{c4::Annular Ligament}}</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 2.22.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.42.09 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.42.30 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.39.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.39.52 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.40.36 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.40.59 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.41.23 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.41.46 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.42.09 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 1.42.30 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/kocher-approach-to-the-elbow/"">VuMedi: Kocher Approach to the Elbow</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-forearm/approach/lateral-approach"">AO: Kaplan and Kocher Approaches to the Lateral Elbow</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::Kocher"

</div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>"	"Incision usually crossed by the <b>Posterior Branch </b>of the <b>MABC n.</b>, Take care of this nerve during Subcutaneous Dissection. If <b>Divided, Neuroma formation</b> can occur<br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.25.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.32.00 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.23.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.23.38 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.24.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.25.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.25.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.26.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.26.40 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.26.57 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.27.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.27.34 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-humerus/approach/medial-approach"">AO: Medial Approach to Distal Humerus</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/pediatric-trauma/distal-humerus/approach/medial-approach"">AO: Medial Approach to Pediatric Distal Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::Medial"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Medial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow &amp; Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Skin &amp; Subcutaneous Tissues</b> are Carefully Dissected; <b>{{c1::MABC}} Branches</b> are <b>Identified {{c1::DISTAL}}</b> to the <b>Medial Epicondyle &amp; Protected</b>; the <b>Ulnar n.</b> is <b>Identified</b> Within {{c1::<b>Fascia Posterior</b> to the <b>Medial Epicondyle</b>}}
<br></div>
<div>2. <b>Incise Fascia </b>&amp; <b>All</b> {{c2::<b>Points</b> of <b>Compression</b>}} <b>Over</b> the <b>Ulnar nerve</b> to <b>Isolate </b>and <b>Protect </b>the
<b>nerve </b>during <b>Exposure
</b></div>
<div>- <b>Resect </b>the <b>{{c3::Medial Intermuscular Septum}} </b>&amp; <b>Decompress Sites </b>of {{c3::<b>Ulnar </b>nerve <b>Compression</b>}} if <b>Ulnar n. Transposition </b>is<b> Planned&nbsp;</b><br>3. <b>After</b> the <b>Ulnar </b>nerve is <b>Transposed</b>, the <b>{{c4::Epicondyle}} </b>and <b>{{c4::Medial Column}} </b>can be <b>Exposed</b> for <b>ORIF</b></div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

<div>4. <b>Incise </b>the <b>Fascia</b> over the <b>{{c5::Superficial Flexor}}</b> <b>Muscles</b> and <b>Retract </b>this <b>{{c5::Anteriorly}}</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Common Flexor Tendon Origin</b> on the <b>Medial Epicondyle</b><br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Medial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow &amp; Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1. Visualize </b>and <b>Protect </b>the {{c1::<b>Ulnar</b> nerve}} at All Times</div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>2. Incise </b>the <b>Anterior 1/3</b> of the <b>{{c2::Flexor Pronator}} Fascia</b> and <b>Underlying Muscle</b> &amp; <b>Divide Proximally</b>,<b> Leaving</b> a {{c2::<b>Cuff</b> of <b>Tendon</b> for <b>Repair&nbsp;</b>}}<br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>3. Elevate</b> <b>Underneath</b> the <b>{{c3::Flexor Pronator}} Muscle</b> and <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c3::Elbow Capsule}}<br>4.</b> Place a
<b>Hohmann Retractor</b>&nbsp;<b>Under</b> the <b>{{c4::Brachialis}} Muscle</b> to <b>Protect </b>the {{c4::<b>Median</b> nerve}} and {{c4::<b>Brachial
</b>artery}}
</div>
<div><b>5.</b> A<b>&nbsp;</b>{{c5::<b>Capsulectomy</b>}} can be <b>Performed</b> at this time to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Elbow Joint</b>; <b>{{c5::Coronoid}} Fractures</b>
can be <b>Exposed &amp; ORIF</b> can be <b>Performed</b> with this <b>Exposure&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

"How can the&nbsp;<b>Medial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow &amp; Humerus&nbsp;</b>be<b>&nbsp;Extended Proximally</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>1. </b>Can be Performed <b>Along</b> the <b>{{c1::Medial Supracondylar Ridge}}</b><br>- Take care to <b>Prevent Injury</b> to the <b>MCL Origin</b> on the <b>{{c2::Posterior}} Aspect</b> of the <b>{{c2::Medial Epicondyle}}</b></div><div><b>2. Dissection</b> can be <b>Followed Proximally</b> in a <b>Subperiosteal Manner</b> to Expose the <b>{{c3::Medial Condyle}} &amp; {{c3::Humeral Shaft}}</b> for <b>ORIF</b> of <b>Medial Column fractures&nbsp;</b></div><div><b>3. Distal Extension</b> is <b>Limited </b>by <b>{{c4::Ulnar nerve}}</b> and <b>{{c4::Flexor Pronator Mass}}</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.27.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.27.34 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.23.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.23.38 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.24.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.25.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.25.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.26.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.26.40 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.26.57 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.27.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.27.34 PM.png"">"		"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.56.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 3.57.03 PM.png"">"	"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-humerus/approach/medial-approach"">AO: Medial Approach to Distal Humerus</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/pediatric-trauma/distal-humerus/approach/medial-approach"">AO: Medial Approach to Pediatric Distal Humerus</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::Medial"
"What are the Main Hazards during the<b>&nbsp;Medial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Elbow &amp; Humerus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::AntecubitalFossa"
"What are the&nbsp;<b>Anatomic Landmarks&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Anterior Approach</b> to the <b>Elbow &amp; Antecubital Fossa</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::Brachioradialis<br>Biceps Tendon}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 5.05.06 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 5.04.42 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::AntecubitalFossa"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Anterior Approach</b> to the <b>Elbow &amp; Antecubital Fossa</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>{{c1::Curved::Shape}}</b> <b>Incision</b> Beginning <b>Transversely</b> in the {{c1::Flexion Crease}}, <b>Extending Proximally</b>&nbsp;Along the {{c1::<b>Medial Border</b> of the <b>Biceps</b> Muscle}}, and <b>Extending Distally</b> Along the {{c1::<b>Radial Border</b> of the <b>Brachioradialis</b> muscle}}
<br><br></div>
<div><b>Avoid Creating </b>{{c2::90}}-Degree <b>Angles</b> when <b>Crossing</b> the <b>Flexion Crease&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 5.07.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::AntecubitalFossa"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterior Approach</b> to the <b>Elbow &amp; Antecubital Fossa</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Incise Skin</b> and <b>Subcutaneous</b> Tissues Carefully to <b>Avoid Violating</b> the <b>Medial </b>or <b>Lateral </b>{{c1::<b>Antebrachial Cutaneous</b> nerves}}, which <b>Lie</b> in <b>Close Proximity
</b></div>
<div>2. <b>Incise Fascia</b> Overlying <b>Muscles</b> and <b>Identify &amp; Protect </b>the <b>{{c2::LABC}}</b>, which <b>Lies</b> just <b>Lateral</b> to the <b>Biceps</b> muscle
</div>
<div>3. <b>Carefully Incise</b> &amp; <b>Reflect</b> the {{c3::<b>Biceps Aponeurosis</b> (Lacertus Fibrosus)}} near its <b>Origin</b> on the <b>{{c3::Biceps Tendon}}
</b></div>
<div>4. <b>Identify</b> Several Structures: the <b>{{c4::Brachial}}</b> artery Lies <b>Directly UNDER Aponeurosis</b> and <b>Bifurcates</b>
just <b>Distal</b> to this <b>Point</b> to Become the {{c4::<b>Radial </b>and <b>Ulnar</b>}} arteries; the <b>{{c4::Median}}</b> nerve and <b>{{c4::Brachial}}</b> vein also are in this Area</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"The <b>Median </b>nerve is the <b>Most Medial Structure&nbsp;<br></b><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.21 PM.png""><b><br></b>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Elbow::AntecubitalFossa"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterior Approach</b> to the <b>Elbow &amp; Antecubital Fossa</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Retract</b> the <b>{{c1::Brachioradialis}}</b> muscle <b>Laterally</b> and the <b>{{c1::Pronator Teres}} </b>muscle <b>Medially</b>; fully <b>Supinate</b> the <b>Forearm</b> to <b>Protect </b>the<b> PIN</b></div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

<div>2. <b>Identify Recurrent</b> <b>branches</b> of the {{c2::<b>Radial </b>artery}} and <b>Ligate</b> them to permit <b>Deeper Dissection
</b><br>3. <b>Identify</b> and <b>Carefully Incise</b> the <b>{{c3::Supinator}}</b> muscle from its <b>Origin</b> and <b>Subperiosteally Dissect </b>on the <b>Radius</b> to <b>Expose</b> the {{c3::<b>Anterior Elbow Joint capsule</b>}}</div><div>4. Carefully <b>Identify </b>and <b>Protect</b> the <b>{{c4::PIN}}</b> and <b>{{c4::Superficial Sensory}}</b> nerve <b>Branches</b> in the <b>Anterior Elbow</b></div><div>5. <b>Incise t</b>he <b>Joint Capsule</b> to <b>Expose </b>the&nbsp;<b>Anterior Elbow Joint</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
