"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.55.14 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.54.58 AM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.24 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.48 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.30 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.44.23 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.53 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.43.30 AM.png"">"	"<b>Applied Surgical Anatomy&nbsp;</b>of the&nbsp;<b>Volar Wrist</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b>Palm</b>:<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.47.19 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.34 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.57 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.27 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.52 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.50.15 AM.png"">"				"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::UlnarNerve"
"<div><div><div>Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the <b>Approach</b> to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar nerve &amp; artery</b>&nbsp;in the&nbsp;<b>Distal Forearm &amp; Palm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>Palpate t</b>he {{c1::<b>Hook</b> of the <b>Hamate</b>}} and the <b>{{c1::Pisiform}}</b> - These <b>2 Bones</b> form the <b>Boundaries</b> of the <b>Guyon Canal </b>in the <b>Palm</b><br>
- A <b>Longitudinal Incision</b> along the <b>{{c2::FCU}} Tendon</b> to the <b>Level</b> of the <b>{{c2::Wrist Crease}}</b> is Marked<br>
- For<b> Distal Extension</b> of the approach, a <b>{{c3::Bruner}}</b>-type <b>Extension</b> is made in the <b>Palm</b> between the <b>{{c3::Hamate Hook}}</b> and the <b>{{c3::Pisiform}}</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.24 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.48 AM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.24 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.48 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.30 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.44.23 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.53 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.43.30 AM.png"">"	"<b>Applied Surgical Anatomy&nbsp;</b>of the&nbsp;<b>Volar Wrist</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b>Palm</b>:<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.47.19 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.34 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.57 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.27 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.52 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.50.15 AM.png"">"				"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::UlnarNerve"
"<div><div><div>What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b> to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar nerve &amp; artery</b>&nbsp;in the&nbsp;<b>Distal Forearm &amp; Palm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c1::FCU}} Tendon</b> and <b>Divide</b> the <b>Sheath</b> of the Tendon so it can be <b>Retracted</b> <b>{{c1::Ulnar}}ly</b>
along with the <b>Muscle Belly
</b></div>
<div>2. The <b>Ulnar nerve</b> and <b>artery</b> are <b>{{c2::DEEP}}</b> to the <b>FCU Tendon</b> and are <b>Identified</b> in the <b>{{c2::Distal}} Forearm</b> <br>- The <b>Ulnar Nerve</b> is {{c3::<b>Dorsal</b> and <b>Ulnar</b>}} to the <b>Artery
</b></div>
<div>3. <b>Identify</b> the <b>Artery</b> and <b>Nerve</b> and Slowly <b>Follow </b>these structures into the<b> Palm&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.53 AM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.24 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.48 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.30 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.44.23 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.53 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.43.30 AM.png"">"	"<b>Applied Surgical Anatomy&nbsp;</b>of the&nbsp;<b>Volar Wrist</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b>Palm</b>:<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.47.19 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.34 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.57 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.27 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.52 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.50.15 AM.png"">"				"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::UlnarNerve"
"<div><div><div>What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Approach</b> to the&nbsp;<b>Ulnar nerve &amp; artery</b>&nbsp;in the&nbsp;<b>Distal Forearm &amp; Palm</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. Carefully <b>Divide</b> the <b>{{c1::Palmar Fascia}}</b> over the <b>Neurovascular structures</b></div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>2. By<b> Dissecting</b> from a <b>{{c2::Proximal}}</b> to <b>{{c2::Distal}} Direction</b>, <b>Branches</b> of the <b>Ulnar</b> nerve are <b>Identified</b> in the <b>Palm</b></div><div>3. The <b>Motor branch</b> Dives Around the {{c3::<b>Hook</b> of the <b>Hamate</b>}} to <b>Innervate</b> the <b>Intrinsic muscles
</b></div>
<div>- The <b>Sensory</b> branch <b>Innervates </b>the <b>{{c4::Radial}} Aspect</b> of the <b>{{c4::Ring}} </b>and <b>{{c4::Small}} Fingers</b><br>
- The <b>Ulnar artery</b> makes a <b>Contribution</b> to the <b>{{c5::Superficial}} Palmar Arch</b>, and the <b>Ulnar Digital artery</b> makes a <b>Contribution</b> to the <b>{{c5::Small}} Finger&nbsp;</b><div><div><div><div>
<div>4. For <b>Decompression</b> of the <b>Guyon canal</b>, <b>{{c6::ALL}} Branches</b> of the <b>Ulnar nerve</b> should be <b>Decompressed</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
"	"Because <b>Variability</b> exists in the <b>Branching Pattern</b>, Careful <b>Dissection</b> should be Performed with <b>Loupe Magnification</b><br>The <b>Floor </b>of the Guyon canal is the <b>TCL<br></b><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.43.30 AM.png""><b><br></b>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.24 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.41.48 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.30 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.44.23 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.42.53 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.43.30 AM.png"">"	"<b>Applied Surgical Anatomy&nbsp;</b>of the&nbsp;<b>Volar Wrist</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b>Palm</b>:<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.47.19 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.34 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.48.57 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.27 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.49.52 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-08 at 9.50.15 AM.png"">"				"#Ortho::Approaches::Hand_Wrist::UlnarNerve"

"What is the&nbsp;<b>POSITION</b>&nbsp;of the Patient when using&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<div><u>SUPINE</u><br>- Flexion of the Hip and Knee; place the Lateral side of the Affected Ankle on the Opposite Knee<br>- Lateral position with the Affected Leg Nearest the table; Flexion of the Opposite Knee moves its ankle out of the way</div><div>
- Placing a Bump under the CONTRALATERAL Hip allows Maximal External Rotation of the Hip; the Retractor should be placed Posterior to the FHL to Protect the Bundle&nbsp;</div>}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.00.08 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.32 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.54.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.43 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/malleoli/approach/posteromedial-approach"">AO: Posteromedial Approach to the Malleoli</a>"	"<img src=""FNW8OGkXwAYt7QB.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Posteromedial"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Posteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::An <u>8-10 cm</u> Incision should be made Midway between the <u>Medial Malleolus and Achilles Tendon</u> at the <u>level of the Ankle</u>}}</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.54.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""44_a040_i100.jpg"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.32 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.54.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.43 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/malleoli/approach/posteromedial-approach"">AO: Posteromedial Approach to the Malleoli</a>"	"<img src=""FNW8OGkXwAYt7QB.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Posteromedial"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>1. <b>Deepen</b> the <b>Approach</b> through the <b>{{c1::Subcutaneous Fat}} </b>and the <b>{{c1::Fascia}}</b>, in a <b>Direct Line</b> with the <b>{{c1::Posteromedial Crest}}</b> of the <b>Tibia</b></div><div>2. <b>Deepen</b> the <b>Dissection</b> of the <b>Fracture Site</b> WITHOUT <b>Stripping off</b> the <b>{{c2::Periosteum}}</b></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.02 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.32 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.54.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.43 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/malleoli/approach/posteromedial-approach"">AO: Posteromedial Approach to the Malleoli</a>"	"<img src=""FNW8OGkXwAYt7QB.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Posteromedial"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. Using <b>Blunt Dissection</b>, Identify the <b>Fat Plane</b> between the <b>{{c1::Achilles Tendon}} </b>and <b>{{c1::FHL}} </b><br>2. <b>Retract</b> the <b>{{c2::Achilles Tendon}}</b> and <b>{{c2::Retrotendinous Fat}} Laterally</b>, which <b>Exposes</b> the <b>Fascia </b>of the <b>Deeper {{c2::Flexor Compartment}}</b></div><div>3. <b>Identify</b> the <b>Fascial Plane</b> in the <b>{{c3::Anterior}} Flap</b> that <b>Covers </b>the {{c3::<b>Tendons</b> of the <b>Flexor Retinaculum</b>}}
</div>
<div>4.&nbsp;<b>Incise</b> this <b>{{c4::Deep Fascia}}</b> along the <b>Length</b> of the <b>Incision</b>, and <b>One </b>by <b>One Expose</b> and <b>Identify</b>
the <b>Contents</b> of the <b>{{c4::Flexor Retinaculum}}</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"The <b>FHL</b> tendon <b>Protects</b> the more <b>Anterior </b>and <b>Medial Tibial nerve</b> and the <b>Posterior Tibial Artery/Vein</b><br>This procedure <b>facilitates Medial Retraction</b> of the Structures, <b>Aiding Exposure</b> of the <b>Posterior Mal</b> and the <b>Posterior </b>part of the<b> Ankle joint&nbsp;</b><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.43 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.32 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.54.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.43 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/malleoli/approach/posteromedial-approach"">AO: Posteromedial Approach to the Malleoli</a>"	"<img src=""FNW8OGkXwAYt7QB.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Posteromedial"
What are the <b>Main Hazards&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br>{{c1::FHL Tendon<br>Tibial nerve<br>Posterior Tibial Artery/Vein&nbsp;}}	"Also<b> Saphenous Vein</b> and <b>Nerve</b>, especially <b>Distally</b><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.13.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.14.03 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.14.26 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.32 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.54.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.53.56 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.27 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 12.55.43 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/malleoli/approach/posteromedial-approach"">AO: Posteromedial Approach to the Malleoli</a>"	"<img src=""FNW8OGkXwAYt7QB.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Posteromedial"

"What are the <b>Main Hazards</b>&nbsp;during the <b><u>Incision</u></b> of the&nbsp;<b>Posterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Raise</b> the <b>Skin Flaps</b> carefully; <b>Watch</b> for the <b>{{c1::Lesser Saphenous}} vein</b> and the <b>{{c1::Sural}} nerve</b>&nbsp;Behind
the <b>Lateral Mal</b></div>
<div>2. <b>Incise</b> the <b>{{c2::Deep Fascia}}</b> in <b>Line</b> with the <b>Skin Incision</b><br><font color=""#333333"">-&nbsp;</font><b>Identify</b> the <b>2</b> {{c2::<b>Peroneal Tendons</b> (the <b>Brevis</b> is more <b>Muscular </b>and is more <b>Anterior Behind</b> the <b>Fibula</b> at this <b>Level</b>)}}</div><div>3. <b>Incise</b> the <b>{{c3::Peroneal Retinaculum}}</b> to <b>Mobilize</b> the <b>Tendons {{c3::Laterally}}</b>, which <b>Exposes</b> the {{c3::<b>FHL</b> (the FHL is <b>also Muscular </b>at this <b>Level</b>)&nbsp;}}</div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<a href=""https://www.vumedi.com/video/posterolateral-approach-for-trimalleolar-ankle-fracture/"">VuMedi: Posterolateral Approach for Trimalleolar Ankle Fracture</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.21.47 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.18.03 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.22.09 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.18.25 PM.png""><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.21.47 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.18.43 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-13 at 1.19.09 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/malleoli/approach/posterolateral-approach-to-the-volkmann-fragment"">AO: Posterolateral approach to the Volkmann fragment in the malleoli</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Posterolateral"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Incise</b> the <b>Fascia</b> over the <b>{{c1::FHL}}</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Muscle Fibers</b><br>2. Using <b>Sharp Dissection</b>, <b>Elevate</b> the <b>Fibers</b> of the <b>{{c1::FHL}}</b> from the <b>Fibula</b><br>3. <b>Retract</b> the <b>{{c2::FHL}} Medially</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Periosteum</b>; further <b>Subperiosteal </b>Reflection <b>Exposes</b> the<b> Posterior Surface</b> of the <b>{{c2::Tibia}} </b>and <b>{{c2::Ankle joint}}</b></div>
</div>

</div></div></div></div>

"How can the&nbsp;<b>Posterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle&nbsp;</b>be<b>&nbsp;Extended Proximally</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Develop</b> the <b>Muscular Plane</b> between the <b>{{c1::Peroneals}}</b> and the {{c1::<b>Lateral Head</b> of the <b>Gastrocnemius</b>}}</div><div><div><div><div>
2. The {{c2::<b>FHL</b>}} is <b>Reflected</b> from the <b>Fibula</b> and <b>Retracted</b> <b>{{c2::Medially}}</b>; further <b>Exposure</b> can be Achieved <b>Medially</b> across the <b>{{c3::Interosseous Membrane}}</b> and {{c3::<b>Posterior Surface</b> of the <b>Tibia</b>}}</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the <b>Modified Henry (FCR) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Distal Radius</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Palpate the FCR, make an Incision along its Radial Border}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.48.36 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.49.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.49.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.50.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.50.36 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-forearm/approach/palmar-approach--modified-henry-approach"">AO: Modified Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
What is the&nbsp;<b>Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Modified Henry (FCR) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Distal Radius</b>?<br><br>1. The <b>{{c1::FCR}} Sheath</b> is <b>Opened</b>, and the <b>Tendon</b> is <b>Retracted {{c1::Ulnarly}}</b><br>2. <b>Deepen</b> the <b>Incision</b> between the <b>{{c2::FPL}}</b> and the <b>{{c2::Radial artery}}</b><br>- <b>Avoid Damaging</b> the <b>{{c2::Radial a.}}</b> on the <b>Radial Side</b>, and the {{c2::<b>Palmar Cutaneous</b> branch of the <b>Median</b> n.}} on the <b>Ulnar Side</b><br>3. A <b>Finger</b> is used to <b>Sweep </b>the <b>{{c3::FPL}} </b>Muscle<b> Belly</b> Towards the <b>Ulna</b>, which INCREASES the <b>Space</b> and <b>Exposes</b> the <b>{{c3::Pronator Quadratus}}</b> Muscle<br>4. The <b>{{c4::PQ}} </b>Muscle is elevated using an <b>{{c4::L}}-shaped incision</b>, with the <b>Horizontal Limb</b> placed at the <b>{{c4::Watershed Line}}</b><br>5. The <b>PQ Muscle</b> is Incised on its <b>{{c5::Radial}}</b> Border, <b>Exposing</b> the <b>Distal Radius</b> &amp; <b>Stripped</b> off the Distal Radius <u>Together</u> with the <b>Periosteum</b>	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.48.36 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.49.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.49.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.50.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.50.36 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-forearm/approach/palmar-approach--modified-henry-approach"">AO: Modified Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
What is the&nbsp;<b>Closure</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;After</b>&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Modified Henry (FCR) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Distal Radius</b>?<br><br><div>1. The <b>PQ </b>should be <b>placed over </b>the <b>{{c1::Plate}}</b></div><div>2. <b>Every Attempt</b> should be made to <b>Reattach </b>the <b>{{c2::Horizontal}} Limb</b> of the <b>PQ Elevation</b> to the <b>{{c2::Capsule}}</b></div><div>3. If possible, it should be <b>Reattached</b> to its <b>{{c2::Radial}} Insertion</b></div>	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.48.36 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.49.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.49.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.50.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.50.36 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.34.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.33.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.37.50 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 1.36.52 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-forearm/approach/palmar-approach--modified-henry-approach"">AO: Modified Henry Approach</a>"	"<iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/glyfgz3YWB0"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::VolarHenry"
"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Volar Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm Fasciotomies</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div><b>{{c1::Curvilinear::Shape?}}</b>&nbsp;Incision to <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c1::Underlying Fascia}}</b><br><b>Starts</b> at {{c2::<b>Midline</b> of <b>Palm</b>}}, <b>Ulnarly</b> to {{c2::<b>Wrist</b> Border}}, <b>Radially</b> to <b>{{c2::Mobile Wad}}</b>, and <b>Ulnarly</b> to <b>{{c2::Medial Epicondyle}}</b>, Following <b>Medial Border </b>of <b>{{c2::Biceps}} Proximally</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"Allows adequate soft tissue coverage of neurovascular structures and tendons if the wound is left open or skin is grafted later&nbsp;<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.05 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.07.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.26 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.59 PM-35bc155c34b48d8ec04ddb5b4a2b7cd2d5216676.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::Compartment"
"What is the <b>Superficial&nbsp;Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm Fasciotomies</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. Incise the <b>Skin </b>and <b>Subcutaneous Tissues</b>; <b>Avoid</b> the <b>{{c1::LABC}} nerve</b> as it Runs on the <b>Anterolateral Forearm</b></div><div>2. Incise the <b>Fascia</b> overlying the <b>{{c1::Mobile Wad}}</b> and the <b>{{c1::Superficial Flexor}} </b>muscles, including the <b>FCR</b>, <b>Pronator Teres</b>, and <b>Palmaris Longus&nbsp;</b></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.05 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.07.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.26 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.59 PM-35bc155c34b48d8ec04ddb5b4a2b7cd2d5216676.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::Compartment"
"What is the <b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Volar Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm Fasciotomies</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. Identify &amp;<b> Bluntly divide</b> the <b>Interval</b> between the <b>{{c1::Brachioradialis}}</b> &amp; <b>{{c1::FCR}}</b>, taking care to <b>Identify</b> the <b>Superficial Radial n. </b>and the <b>Radial a.</b>&nbsp;Directly <b>Beneath</b> the <b>{{c1::Brachioradialis}}</b></div><div><div><div><div>2. Through this <b>Interval</b>, <b>Incise</b> the <b>Fascia Overlying</b> the <b>{{c1::Deep Flexors}}</b> of the <b>Forearm</b>, including the <b>FDS</b>, <b>FDP</b>, and <b>FPL</b></div><div>3. All <b>Volar Muscle Compartments</b> and the <b>Mobile Wad</b> should be <b>Released&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.59 PM-35bc155c34b48d8ec04ddb5b4a2b7cd2d5216676.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.07.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.05 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.26 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.08.59 PM-35bc155c34b48d8ec04ddb5b4a2b7cd2d5216676.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::Compartment"
Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm Fasciotomies</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Linear Incision Along the Midline of the Dorsal Forearm}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.24.15 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.23.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.24.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.24.38 PM.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::Compartment"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Dorsal Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Forearm Fasciotomies</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. Incise the <b>Skin</b> and <b>Subcutaneous</b> Tissues Over the <b>Dorsal Forearm</b> in a {{c1::Longitudinal}} manner<br>2. Incise the <b>Fascia Overlying</b> the {{c1::Extensor Muscle Bellies&nbsp;}}</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.24.38 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.23.17 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.24.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-14 at 2.24.38 PM.png"">"					"#Ortho::Approaches::Forearm::Compartment"

<b>Distal Biceps</b> Tendon <b>Ruptures</b>&nbsp;Tend to <b>Occur</b> in the {{c1::Dominant::Dominant/Nondominant?}} <b>Elbow (86%)</b> of {{c1::Men::Men or Women}} <b>(93%)</b> in their <b>40s</b>. What are the <b>Risk Factors</b>&nbsp;for&nbsp;<b>Distal Biceps</b> Tendon <b>Ruptures</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Anabolic Steroids <br>Smoking (7.5x greater risk than nonsmokers) <br>Hypovascularity<br>Intrinsic Degeneration<br>Mechanical Impingement in the Space Available for the Biceps Tendon}}						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"

The <b>Short&nbsp;Head</b> of the <b>Biceps Attaches</b>&nbsp;on the <b>Radial Tuberosity</b> {{c1::DISTALLY::Proximally or Distally?}} at the {{c1::Thin Sliver::Name?}}, and is a <b>Better</b> {{c1::Flexor::Flexor or Supinator?}}	"<b>Origin</b> is the <b>Coracoid</b><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-15 at 3.13.17 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"

What is the Classic <b>History</b> for a <b>Distal Biceps Tear</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Painful “Pop” as the Elbow is Eccentrically Loaded from Flexion to Extension}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-15 at 6.17.42 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"

"What can be Seen on <b>Physical Exam</b> of&nbsp;a <b>Distal Biceps Tear</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Varying Degree of <u>Proximal Retraction</u> of the Muscle Belly&nbsp;<a href=""https://upload.orthobullets.com/topic/3081/images/popeye.jpg""><i></i></a>&nbsp;(“Reverse Popeye Sign”)}}<br>{{c1::<u>Change in Contour</u> of the Muscle, Proximally}}<br>{{c1::Medial <u>Ecchymosis</u>}}<br>{{c1::Palpable <u>Defect</u>}}"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-15 at 6.17.42 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"
"How do you <b>Perform</b> a ""<b>Hook Test</b>"" for a <b>Distal Biceps Tear</b>?<br><br><b>Position:</b> {{c1::Have Patient <u>Actively Flex the Elbow to 90°</u> and <u>Fully Supinate the Forearm</u>}} <br><b>Exam Maneuver:</b> {{c1::Use Index Finger to <u>Hook the Lateral edge</u> of the Biceps Tendon}}<br>- With an <b>Intact / Partially Torn Tendon</b>, <b>Finger</b> can be <b>Inserted</b> {{c1::1 cm}} <b>Beneath</b> the <b>Tendon</b>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-15 at 6.17.42 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"
"What Things can cause a <b>False Positive</b> ""<b>Hook Test</b>"" for a <b>Distal Biceps Tear</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Partial Tear}}<br>{{c1::Intact Lacertus Fibrosis}}<br>{{c1::Underlying Brachialis Tendon}}"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-15 at 6.17.42 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"
"How should Patients be <b>Positioned</b> to <b>Increase</b> the <b>Sensitivity</b> of <b>MRI </b>for&nbsp;<b>Distal Biceps Tear</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Elbow Flexion, Shoulder ABduction, Forearm Supination (""FABS"" Position)}}"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-15 at 6.25.51 PM.png""><br><img src=""screen_shot_2017-03-23_at_1.17.38_pm.jpg""><br><br><b>Partial Thickness </b>Tear:<br><img src=""partial.jpg""><br><br><img src=""distal biceps.jpg"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.08 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.13 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.25 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.50.29 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.51.35 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.49.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-07 at 4.52.59 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/shoulder-and-elbow/3081/distal-biceps-avulsion"">Orthobullets: Distal Biceps Avulsion</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::ShoulderElbow::Elbow::Tendon_Conditions_Tears::DistalBiceps"

<b>Knee Arthroscopy - <u>Anteromedial</u> Portal<br><br>Technique &amp; Location:&nbsp;</b>{{c1::<b>Make&nbsp;</b>with Knee in&nbsp;<b>FLEXION</b>, just <b>Medial</b> to the <b>Patellar</b> Tendon and Just <b>Above</b> the <b>Joint Line</b>}}<br><b>Use:&nbsp;</b>{{c2::Primary <u><b>INSTRUMENTATION</b></u> Portal}}	"<div>

What is the <b>Treatment</b> for <b>Dorsal Malunion</b>&nbsp;of&nbsp;<b>Talar Neck</b>&nbsp;fractures?<br><br>{{c1::Resection of Talar Neck}}	Limited <b>Dorsiflexion &amp; Impingement </b>of the <b>Dorsal Beak</b>				"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/talus/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-talus"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Talus</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/talus/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-talus"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Talus</a><br><iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/iDXZ__75otU"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"				"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1048/talar-neck-fractures"">Orthobullets: Talar Neck Fractures</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::LowerExtremity::Hindfoot::TalarNeckFx"
Should <b><u>Closed</u></b>&nbsp;<b>Talar Neck</b>&nbsp;fractures be Treated with <b>Immediate</b> or <b>Delayed ORIF</b>?<br><br>{{c1::DELAYED}}	<div><b>Delayed ORIF</b> (if Closed) allows for <b>Soft Tissue Rest</b> &amp; is associated w/ <b>Lower Rates</b> of <b>Infection, Skin Necrosis</b>, and <b>Dehiscence</b> WITHOUT an Increased Risk of <b>Osteonecrosis</b></div>				"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/talus/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-talus"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Talus</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/talus/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-talus"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Talus</a><br><iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/iDXZ__75otU"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"				"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1048/talar-neck-fractures"">Orthobullets: Talar Neck Fractures</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::LowerExtremity::Hindfoot::TalarNeckFx"
What is the <b>Blood Supply</b> to the&nbsp;<b>Talar Body</b>?<br><br><b>Main</b>: {{c1::Artery of the Tarsal Canal (Lateral 2/3s of Body)}}<br><b>Accessory</b>: {{c1::Deltoid branch (Medial 1/3), Peroneal/Posterior Tib Anastomosis (Posterior Facet)}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.29.23 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-20 at 7.10.56 AM.png"">"				"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/talus/approach/anterolateral-approach-to-the-talus"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Talus</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/talus/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-talus"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Talus</a><br><iframe allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen="""" frameborder=""0"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/iDXZ__75otU"" title=""YouTube video player"" width=""560""></iframe>"				"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1048/talar-neck-fractures"">Orthobullets: Talar Neck Fractures</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Trauma::LowerExtremity::Hindfoot::TalarNeckFx"
What is the <b>Blood Supply</b> to the&nbsp;<b>Talar Head</b>?<br><br><b>Superomedial</b>: {{c1::Anterior Tibial a. For&nbsp;<b>Carpal Tunnel</b>&nbsp;Syndrome, What are the <b>6 Primary Diagnostic Criteria</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Numbness and Tingling}} in the <b>Median nerve Distribution</b><br>{{c1::Nocturnal}} <b>Numbness</b><br><b>Weakness </b>and/or <b>Atrophy</b> of the {{c1::Thenar musculature}}<br><b>Positive </b>{{c1::Tinel sign}}<br><b>Positive</b> {{c1::Phalen test}}<br><b>Loss</b> of {{c1::2-Point Discrimination}}						"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.02.44 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.18 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.03.43 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.10 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.04.34 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.02 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.05.35 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.07.21 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-01-20 at 4.06.04 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/hand/6018/carpal-tunnel-syndrome"">Orthobullets: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Hand::Neuropathies::Median::CarpalTunnel"

"<div><div><div><div><div><div><div><div>What is the<b>&nbsp;Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterior Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Clavicle</b>?<br><br>1. The <b>{{c1::Platysma}}</b> is <b>Incised Transversely</b> and <b>Tagged</b> with <b>Sutures</b><br>
</div><div>2. <b>Identify</b> the <b>{{c2::Supraclavicular}} </b>nerves and make Every Effort to <b>Preserve them</b><br>3. <b>Incise</b> the <b>{{c3::Clavipectoral Fascia}}</b>. This will <b>Expose</b> the <b>Underlying Clavicle</b> and the <b>Attached</b> <b>{{c3::Pectoralis Major}} Anteriorly</b>, and <b>{{c3::Trapezius}} Posteriorly</b></div><div>4. <b>Minimal Soft Tissue Dissection</b> of <b>Underlying Clavipectoral Fascia</b> is performed to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Fracture</b>. This can be performed <b>Bluntly</b> with a <b>Periosteal Elevator</b> or <b>Sharply </b>with a <b>Blade</b></div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Position</b>&nbsp;of the Patient during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Tibial Plateau</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>

<div>{{c1::Supine on a Radiolucent table, with a Firm Wedge Beneath the Knee to Flex the Joint to ~ 60<span style=""font-size: 15px;""><sup>o</sup></span>}}<br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 3.39.07 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 3.39.20 AM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-tibia/approach/anterolateral-approach#skin-incision"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Proximal Tibia</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Knee_LowerLeg::Anterolateral_Plateau"

"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Tibial Plateau</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
{{c1::Straight Incision Lateral to the Patella}}<br><br>or<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">Make a(n)&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Inverted L}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">-<b>Shaped Incision</b>. Start approximately <b>1-3 cm Distal</b> to the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Joint Line}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">, staying just <b>Lateral </b>to the <b>Border </b>of the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Patella Tendon}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">.<b> Curve</b> the <b>Incision Anteriorly</b> over&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Gerdy Tubercle}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;and then <b>Extend</b> it <b>Distally</b>, staying
<b>~1 cm&nbsp;</b></span><b>{{c2::Lateral}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;to the <b>Anterior Border</b> of the <b>Tibia&nbsp;</b></span></div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 3.44.25 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 3.43.40 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 3.45.42 AM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-tibia/approach/anterolateral-approach#skin-incision"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Proximal Tibia</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Knee_LowerLeg::Anterolateral_Plateau"
"What is the <b>Internervous Plane&nbsp;</b>used during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Tibial Plateau</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
{{c1::None}}<div><div><div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 4.21.49 AM.png""><br><img src=""41_a02_3a_anterolateral_approach.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-tibia/approach/anterolateral-approach#skin-incision"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Proximal Tibia</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Knee_LowerLeg::Anterolateral_Plateau"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Tibial Plateau</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">1. <b>Deepen</b> the <b>Incision Proximally</b> through <b>Subcutaneous Tissue</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Lateral Aspect </b>of the <b>Knee </b>Joint <b>Capsule</b><br>2. <b>Incise</b> the <b>Knee </b>Joint <b>Capsule Transversely </b>just <b>Below</b> the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c1::Lateral Meniscus}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">. Take Care <b>NOT</b> to <b>Divide </b>the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c1::Lateral Meniscus}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>&nbsp;Inadvertently</b><br>3. <b>Below</b> the <b>Joint Line</b>, <b>Deepen</b> the Incision through <b>Subcutaneous Tissue</b> and <b>Incise</b> the <b>Fascia Overlying</b> the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Tibialis Anterior}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;muscle</span></div>
</div>
</div></div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 11.43.05 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-tibia/approach/anterolateral-approach#skin-incision"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Proximal Tibia</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Knee_LowerLeg::Anterolateral_Plateau"
"What is the <b>DEEP&nbsp;Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral&nbsp;</b>Approach to the&nbsp;<b>Tibial Plateau</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">1.&nbsp;</span><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>Proximally Enter</b> the <b>Knee</b> joint by <b>Dividing </b>the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c1::Synovium}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">. <b>Carefully Detach</b> the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c1::Lateral Meniscus}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;from its <b>Soft Tissue Attachments Inferiorly</b> and Develop a <b>Plane</b> between the&nbsp;</span>{{c1::<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>U</b></span><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>ndersurface</b> of the <b>Lateral Meniscus</b></span>}}&nbsp;<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">and the&nbsp;</span>{{c1::<span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">Underlying <b>Tibial Plateau</b></span>}}</div><div><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">2. Insert <b>Stay Sutures</b> to the <b>Periphery</b> of the <b>Meniscus</b> to Facilitate <b>Reattachment</b> during <b>Closure</b>. Ensure that the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c2::Anterior}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>&nbsp;Attachment </b>of the <b>Meniscus </b>Remains <b>Intact</b><br>3. <b>Detach</b> a Sufficient Amount of the <b>Meniscus</b> to allow <b>Adequate Visualization</b> of the&nbsp;</span><b>{{c3::Superior}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);""><b>&nbsp;Surface</b> of the <b>Lateral Tibial Plateau</b>. Using an <b>Elevator, Inferiorly Detach</b> some of the <b>Origin</b> of&nbsp;</span><b>{{c3::Tibialis Anterior}}</b><span style=""color: rgb(10, 9, 5);"">&nbsp;from the <b>Proximal Tibia</b>.
Try to work in a <b>Plane</b> between the <b>Periosteum</b> and the <b>Muscle&nbsp;</b></span></div>
</div>
</div></div><div><div><div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-24 at 11.50.26 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-tibia/approach/anterolateral-approach#skin-incision"">AO: Anterolateral Approach to the Proximal Tibia</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Knee_LowerLeg::Anterolateral_Plateau"

"What are the <b>Hazards </b>Encountered during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Extensile Lateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Calcaneus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::<u>Lateral Calcaneal branches of Perforating Peroneal a.</u> - Vascular Supply to the Planned Flap is a “Watershed” area; the <u>Corner of the Soft Tissue Flap
at the Juncture of the Longitudinal and Vertical Posterior Incisions</u> must be treated with Infinite Care<br><font color=""#333333""><br><u>S</u></font><u>ural nerve</u> injury can occur in the <u>Proximal and Distal Aspects</u> of the L-shaped incision&nbsp;}}<br></div>

"Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Extensile Lateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Calcaneus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>{{c1::L-Shaped Incision:&nbsp;<u>Posterior</u> Arm - placed Midway between the <u>Fibula and Achilles tendon<br>Horizontal</u> Arm - placed <u>in Line</u> with the <u>Base of the 5th Metatarsal</u>}}</div>
</div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Extensile Lateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Calcaneus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. At the <b>Corner</b>, <b>Incision</b> is made Directly to {{c1::<b>Bone</b>}} to raise a <b>Full-Thickness Flap</b>; <b>Undermining</b> of the {{c1::<b>Edges</b>}}&nbsp;is <b>Avoided</b><br>2. As the <b>Flap</b> is <b>Developed</b>, one <b>Divides</b> the {{c2::<b>Retinaculum</b>}} and <b>Detaches</b> the {{c2::<b>Calcaneofibular</b>}} and {{c2::<b>Talocalcaneal</b>}}&nbsp;<b>Ligaments</b> from <b>Bone
</b></div>
<div>3. The {{c3::<b>Peroneal</b>}}<b>&nbsp;Tendons </b>and the {{c3::<b>Sural</b>}}<b>&nbsp;nerve</b> are Within the <b>Proximal Flap</b> and are<b> Mobilized</b> from
the <b>Lateral Aspect </b>of the <b>Calcaneus</b><br>4. As the <b>Flap </b>is Developed <b>Superiorly</b>, the {{c4::<b>Subtalar</b>}}<b>&nbsp;Joint</b> and
the {{c4::<b>Sinus Tarsi</b>}}&nbsp;are <b>Exposed</b></div>
<div>5. The {{c5::<b>Lateral</b>}}<b>&nbsp;Wall</b> of the <b>Calcaneus</b> and the {{c5::<b>Subtalar</b>}}<b>&nbsp;joint </b>are<b> Exposed</b> to <b>Reduce </b>and <b>Fix Intraarticular </b>fractures of the <b>Calcaneus&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.20 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.57 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.40.22 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.40.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.06 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.20 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.57 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/calcaneous/approach/extended-lateral-approach-to-the-calcaneus"">AO: Extensile Lateral Approach to the Calcaneus</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1051/calcaneus-fractures"">Orthobullets: Calcaneus Fractures</a>"	"<iframe width=""560"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/6-Yx7weoETs"" title=""YouTube video player"" frameborder=""0"" allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Foot::ExtensileLateral_Calcaneus"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Closure</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>Following the&nbsp;<b>Extensile Lateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Calcaneus</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>The <b>{{c2::Peroneal Retinaculum}}</b> and Detached<b> {{c2::Calcaneofibular}}</b> and <b>{{c2::Talocalcaneal}} Ligaments</b> are <b>Repaired </b>{{c1::<b>Side</b>-to-<b>Side</b>}} <b>Prior</b> to <b>Skin Closure&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.20 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 4.00.29 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.40.22 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.40.48 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.06 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.20 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.42 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-26 at 3.41.57 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/calcaneous/approach/extended-lateral-approach-to-the-calcaneus"">AO: Extensile Lateral Approach to the Calcaneus</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1051/calcaneus-fractures"">Orthobullets: Calcaneus Fractures</a>"	"<iframe width=""560"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/6-Yx7weoETs"" title=""YouTube video player"" frameborder=""0"" allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe>"	"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Foot::ExtensileLateral_Calcaneus"
What <b>Muscles</b> make up the <b><u>Superficial</u> Posterior Cervical</b> Group?<br><br>{{c1::Trapezius}}	"<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b><u>Originates</u></b> from the <b>Ligamentum Nuchae &amp; External Occipital Protuberance</b>,
continues to the <b>Spinous Process</b> of <b>T12</b>, and <b><u>Inserts</u></b> onto
the <b>Scapular Spine, Acromion</b>, and <b>Lateral 1/3</b> of the <b>Clavicle</b>. <br><br>Responsible for <b>Elevating, ADducting</b>, and <b>Depressing</b> the <b>Scapula</b>.</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 10.52.44 AM.png"">"										"#Ortho::Netters::Spine::Muscles"
What <b>Muscles</b> make up the <b><u>Intermediate</u> Posterior Cervical</b> Layer?<br><br>{{c1::Splenius Capitis<br>Splenius Cervicis}}	"<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b><u>Originate</u></b> from the <b>Spinous Processes</b> of the <b>Cervicothoracic Vertebrae</b> and <b><u>Insert</u></b> onto the <b>Transverse Processes</b> of <b>Upper Cervical Vertebrae</b> and<b> Base </b>of the<b> Occipital Bone</b>.
<br><br>When contracting <b>bilaterally</b>, they cause <b>neck extension</b>.<br>When contracting <b>unilaterally</b>, each muscle causes
<b>ipsilateral lateral flexion</b>.&nbsp;<br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 10.57.10 AM.png""><br></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"									"<img src=""paste-875b78b29092dbf0c98e0f11bfa2661557095548.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Netters::Spine::Muscles"
What <b>Muscles</b> make up the <b><u>Deep</u> Posterior Cervical</b> Layer?<br><br>{{c1::Superficial and Deep Erector Spinae Muscles}}	"Innervation: <b>Posterior Primary Rami</b><br>Blood Supply: <b>Deep Cervical Vessels<br><br></b><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>From <b>Lateral</b> to<b> Midline</b>, the
<b>Superficial Erector Spinae</b> muscles include the <b>Iliocostalis Cervicis, Longissimus Capitis, Longissimus Cervicis</b>, and <b>Spinalis Cervicis&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><br>The <b>Deep&nbsp;</b><b>Erector Spinae </b>muscles = <b>Transversospinales</b> muscles of the Posterior spine: <b>Semispinalis Cervicis</b>, <b>Multifidus</b>,
and <b>Rotatores&nbsp;<br></b>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- Originate from Transverse Processes and insert on Spinous Processes in an Oblique
fashion, crossing a specific <br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; number of Spinal Segments&nbsp;<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 11.00.53 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 11.01.14 AM.png""><b><br></b>"									"<img src=""paste-875b78b29092dbf0c98e0f11bfa2661557095548.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Netters::Spine::Muscles"
What are the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Cervical Erector Spinae</b>&nbsp;muscles from&nbsp;<b>Lateral</b>&nbsp;to<b>&nbsp;Midline?</b>&nbsp;<br><br>{{c1::<b>Iliocostalis Cervicis</b><br><b>Longissimus Capitis</b><br><b>Longissimus Cervicis</b><br><b>Spinalis Cervicis&nbsp;</b>}}	"Innervation: <b>Posterior Primary Rami</b><br>Blood Supply: <b>Deep Cervical Vessels<br></b><br>The <b>Deep&nbsp;</b><b>Erector Spinae </b>muscles = <b>Transversospinales</b> muscles of the Posterior spine: <b>Semispinalis Cervicis</b>, <b>Multifidus</b>,
and <b>Rotatores&nbsp;<br></b>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- Originate from Transverse Processes and insert on Spinous Processes in an Oblique
fashion, crossing a specific <br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; number of Spinal Segments&nbsp;<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 11.00.53 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 11.01.14 AM.png""><b><br></b>"									"<img src=""paste-875b78b29092dbf0c98e0f11bfa2661557095548.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Netters::Spine::Muscles"
What are the&nbsp;<b>Deep Cervical Erector Spinae</b>&nbsp;muscles<b>?</b>&nbsp;<br><br>{{c1::<b>Transversospinales</b>&nbsp;muscles of the Posterior spine:&nbsp;<br><b>Semispinalis Cervicis</b>,&nbsp;<b>Multifidus</b>, and&nbsp;<b>Rotatores&nbsp;</b>}}	"Innervation: <b>Posterior Primary Rami</b><br>Blood Supply: <b>Deep Cervical Vessels<br></b><b><br></b>Originate from <b>Transverse Processes</b> and Insert on <b>Spinous Processes </b>in an <b>Oblique</b>
fashion, crossing a specific number of Spinal Segments&nbsp;<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 11.01.14 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-02-28 at 11.00.53 AM.png"">"									"<img src=""paste-875b78b29092dbf0c98e0f11bfa2661557095548.jpg"">"	"#Ortho::Netters::Spine::Muscles"
"
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>In the <b>Upper Cervical </b>Region, <b>Suboccipital muscles</b> Attach from the {{c1::Occiput}} to the {{c1::Atlas}} and {{c1::Axis}}</div>
</div>
</div>

"

<div>
<div>
<div>

the <b>Sternal Notch</b> is the <b>Apex&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div></div><br>Further Subdivided into 4 Triangles: <br>(1) the Submental triangle<br>(2) the Muscular or Submandibular triangle<br>(3) the Digastric triangle<br>(4) the Carotid triangle&nbsp;</div>
</div>

the <b>Sternal Notch</b> is the <b>Apex&nbsp;</b></div></div></div></div></div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>

</div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Divide</b> the <b>Superior </b>and <b>Inferior</b> <b>{{c1::Extensor Retinaculum}}</b><br>2. <b>Identify</b> the <b>{{c2::Peroneus Tertius}} </b>and<b> {{c2::EDL}} </b>and Approach the <b>Tibia</b> just <b>{{c2::Lateral}} </b>to these <b>Tendons
</b><br>3. <b>Medial Retraction</b> of the <b>{{c3::Extensor}} Muscle</b> group Exposes the <b>{{c3::Anterior}} Aspect</b> of the <b>Distal Tibia</b> and the <b>Anterior {{c3::Ankle Joint Capsule&nbsp;}}</b></div></div></div>
</div></div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>Proximal Extension</b> can be performed to <b>Explore</b> the <b>Anterior Compartment
</b></div>
<div><br><b>Distal Extension</b> can be used to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Sinus Tarsi</b>, <b>CC joint</b>, and <b>TMT Joint</b> on the <b>Lateral half </b>of the <b>Foot&nbsp;</b></div>
</div>
</div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Proximal Extension</b>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle </b>Used for?<br><div><div><div><br>{{c1::to&nbsp;<b>Explore</b>&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b><u>Anterior Compartment</u></b>}}</div>
</div>
</div>"	"<div>
<div>

"What is the&nbsp;<b>Distal Extension</b>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle </b>Used for?<br><div><div><div><br>{{c1::to&nbsp;<b>Expose</b>&nbsp;the&nbsp;<u><b>Sinus Tarsi</b>,&nbsp;<b>CC joint</b></u>, and&nbsp;<b><u>TMT Joint</u></b>&nbsp;on the&nbsp;<b>Lateral half&nbsp;</b>of the&nbsp;<b>Foot&nbsp;</b>}}</div>

Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Anteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>{{c1::Centered over the Anterior Ankle <u>just Medial to the TA Tendon</u>}}<br></div>	"<b>Skin </b>and <b>Subcutaneous tissue </b>are <b>Incised</b><br><br><img src=""43_a001_i060.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.30.47 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.31.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-distal-tibia"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Ankle</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1046/tibial-plafond-fractures"">Orthobullets: Tibial Plafond Fractures</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-or-anterolateral-approach"">AO: Anteromedial or Anterolateral Approach to the Ankle?</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Anteromedial"
What are the&nbsp;<b>Main Hazard(s)</b>&nbsp;at Risk during the&nbsp;<b>Anteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>{{c1::Branches of the <u>Saphenous nerve</u> and <u>Great Saphenous Vein</u>}}<br></div>	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-13 at 7.22.46 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.45.24 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.48.07 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.30.47 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.31.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-distal-tibia"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Ankle</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1046/tibial-plafond-fractures"">Orthobullets: Tibial Plafond Fractures</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-or-anterolateral-approach"">AO: Anteromedial or Anterolateral Approach to the Ankle?</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Anteromedial"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. The <b>Deep Fascia Medial</b> to the <b>{{c1::Tibialis Anterior}}</b> is <b>Incised</b> and the <b>{{c1::Retinaculum}} </b>is <b>Exposed</b><br>2. The {{c2::<b>Retinaculum</b>}}&nbsp;is <b>Incised</b> <b>Medial</b> to the&nbsp;<b>Tibialis Anterior</b></div>
<div>3. The <b>TA Tendon</b> is <b>Retracted&nbsp;</b>{{c3::<b>Laterally</b>}} along with the <b>EHL </b>and the {{c4::<b>Deep Peroneal</b> nerve/<b>Anterior Tibial</b> artery}}</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div></div>"	"<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.30.47 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.31.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-distal-tibia"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Ankle</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1046/tibial-plafond-fractures"">Orthobullets: Tibial Plafond Fractures</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-or-anterolateral-approach"">AO: Anteromedial or Anterolateral Approach to the Ankle?</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Anteromedial"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anteromedial Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Ankle</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. The {{c1::<b>Anteromedial Ankle</b> Joint<b> Capsule</b>}} is Exposed along with the {{c1::<b>Distal Aspect</b> of the <b>Tibia</b>}}&nbsp;</div><div>2. <b>Ankle Arthrotomy</b> is performed to <b>Visualize</b> the <b>Articular Surfaces</b> of the {{c2::<b>Tibial Plafond</b>}} and {{c2::<b>Talar Dome</b>}}</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.30.47 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.31.11 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-07 at 2.32.15 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-approach-to-the-distal-tibia"">AO: Anteromedial Approach to the Ankle</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/trauma/1046/tibial-plafond-fractures"">Orthobullets: Tibial Plafond Fractures</a><br><a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/distal-tibia/approach/anteromedial-or-anterolateral-approach"">AO: Anteromedial or Anterolateral Approach to the Ankle?</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Foot_Ankle::Ankle::Anteromedial"
What are the&nbsp;<b>Indications</b>&nbsp;to use the&nbsp;<b>Lateral (Hardinge) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br>{{c1::THA<br>Hemiarthroplasty<br>ORIF of Femoral Neck Fractures<br>ORIF of Femoral Head Fractures<br>Hip Arthrotomy<br>Intraarticular Biopsy}}	"<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NrFHwtLAwFk&amp;ab_channel=Dr.VinayKumarSingh"">Lateral (Hardinge) Approach to Hip - Video</a>"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.38.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.41 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.19 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.12 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.55 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.49.13 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-femur/approach/direct-lateral-approach"">AO: Direct Lateral Approach to the Proximal Femur</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/approaches/12022/hip-direct-lateral-approach-hardinge-transgluteal"">Orthobullets: Hip Direct Lateral Approach (Hardinge, Transgluteal)</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Hip::Lateral"
What is the&nbsp;<b>POSITION</b>&nbsp;of the Patient when using&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Lateral&nbsp;</b><b>(Hardinge)&nbsp;</b><b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Supine on Table with Operative side Buttocks just Over the Edge }}<br><br>or<br><br>{{c1::Lateral Decubitus Position with the Operative Side Up}}	"<div>

region&nbsp;</b></div>

Where is the&nbsp;<b>Incision</b>&nbsp;made<b>&nbsp;</b>when using the&nbsp;<b>Lateral&nbsp;</b><b>(Hardinge)&nbsp;</b><b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br>{{c1::<u>Direct Lateral</u> Incision from <u>12-20 cm</u> is made <u>5 cm from the Proximal Tip of the Greater Trochanter</u> along the Lateral Aspect of the Femoral Shaft}}	"<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NrFHwtLAwFk&amp;ab_channel=Dr.VinayKumarSingh"">Lateral (Hardinge) Approach to Hip - Video</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 5.16.21 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.38.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.41 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.19 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.12 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.55 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.49.13 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-femur/approach/direct-lateral-approach"">AO: Direct Lateral Approach to the Proximal Femur</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/approaches/12022/hip-direct-lateral-approach-hardinge-transgluteal"">Orthobullets: Hip Direct Lateral Approach (Hardinge, Transgluteal)</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Hip::Lateral"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Lateral&nbsp;</b><b>(Hardinge)&nbsp;</b><b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br><b>Sharply Dissect </b>the <b>Subcutaneous Tissue</b> down to the <b style="""">Fascia</b> of the&nbsp;{{c1::<u>IT Band}}</u>, the {{c1::<u>TFL}}</u> <b style="""">Superiorly &amp; Anteriorly</b>, and the {{c1::<u>Gluteus Maximus</u>}}&nbsp;<b style="""">Superiorly &amp; Posteriorly</b>&nbsp;"	"<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NrFHwtLAwFk&amp;ab_channel=Dr.VinayKumarSingh"">Lateral (Hardinge) Approach to Hip - Video</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 5.20.34 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.38.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.41 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.19 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.12 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.55 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.49.13 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-femur/approach/direct-lateral-approach"">AO: Direct Lateral Approach to the Proximal Femur</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/approaches/12022/hip-direct-lateral-approach-hardinge-transgluteal"">Orthobullets: Hip Direct Lateral Approach (Hardinge, Transgluteal)</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Hip::Lateral"
"What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Lateral&nbsp;</b><b>(Hardinge)&nbsp;</b><b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>1. <b>Incise</b> the <b>Fascia </b>over the <b>{{c1::TFL}}</b> and the <b>{{c1::Gluteus Maximus}}</b> to <b>Retract </b>the <b>{{c1::TFL}} Anteriorly</b> and the <b>{{c1::Gluteus Maximus}} Posteriorly</b></div>
<div>2. The <b>{{c2::Gluteus Medius}} </b>and <b>{{c2::Vastus Lateralis::Muscles}}</b> are <b>Exposed</b></div><div>- A <b>Self-Retaining Retraction system</b> can be used <b>After </b>the <b>Superficial Dissection</b> is Completed</div>
<div>3. <b>Split</b> the <b>Medius</b> no more than <b>{{c3::5</b><b>}}</b><b>&nbsp;cm Above</b> the <b>Tip</b> of the <b>Greater Trochanter </b>and <b>Carry</b> this <b>Dissection</b> <b>{{c3::2-3</b><b>}}</b><b>&nbsp;cm</b>&nbsp;into the <b>Vastus Lateralis</b></div><div>- This <b>Deep Dissection</b> creates an <b>Anterior Flap</b> consisting of the {{c4::<b>Gluteus Medius</b>}}, the {{c4::<b>Gluteus Minimus</b>}}<b>&nbsp;Tendon</b>, and the {{c4::<b>Vastus Lateralis</b>}}</div><div>- <b>Alternatively</b>, this <b>Deep Dissection </b>can be taken
with a<b> Broad Osteotome</b> to take a <u><b>Thin Flap </b>of <b>Bone off</b></u> with the <b>Attachment </b>of the {{c5::<b>Minimus</b>}}<b>,&nbsp;</b>{{c5::<b>Vastus</b>}}, and<b>&nbsp;</b>{{c5::<b>Medius</b>}}</div>
<div>4. Place a <b>Blunt Retractor</b> to <b>Dissect</b> this<b> Flap </b>from the {{c6::<b>Anterior Capsule</b>}} to <b>Expose</b> it<br>5. The <b>Capsulotomy </b>can be Performed with <b>Release</b> from the <b>Femoral Attachment</b> and a <b>“{{c7::T}}” </b>into
the <b>Acetabular Rim</b>; <b>Blunt Retractors </b>can be placed around the <b>Neck</b> of the<b> Femur</b> to <b>Expose</b> the <b>Joint </b>better&nbsp;</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>"	"<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NrFHwtLAwFk&amp;ab_channel=Dr.VinayKumarSingh"">Lateral (Hardinge) Approach to Hip - Video</a><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.12 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.55 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.49.13 PM.png"">"					"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.19 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.38.15 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.37.41 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.19 PM.png""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.40.37 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.12 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.28 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.47.55 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-03-08 at 2.49.13 PM.png"">"			"<a href=""https://surgeryreference.aofoundation.org/orthopedic-trauma/adult-trauma/proximal-femur/approach/direct-lateral-approach"">AO: Direct Lateral Approach to the Proximal Femur</a><br><a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/approaches/12022/hip-direct-lateral-approach-hardinge-transgluteal"">Orthobullets: Hip Direct Lateral Approach (Hardinge, Transgluteal)</a>"		"#Ortho::Approaches::Hip::Lateral"
"<b>How</b> is the <b>Hip Disolcated</b> Following&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Lateral&nbsp;</b><b>(Hardinge)&nbsp;</b><b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br><div>

<div>{{c1::Gentle External Rotation of the Leg}}</div>

"<b>How</b> is the Surgical Incision<b> Closed </b>following the&nbsp;<b>Lateral&nbsp;</b><b>(Hardinge)&nbsp;</b><b>Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br><div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div><b>Capsular closure</b> can be Accomplished with <b>{{c1::Large Absorbable}}</b> or <b>{{c1::Nonabsorbable}}</b> <b>Suture </b>according to the <b>preference</b> of the surgeon
<br><br></div>
<div>The <b>Anterior Flap</b>, including the {{c2::<b>Medius, Minimus</b>, and <b>Vastus</b>}}, is <b>Reattached</b> to the&nbsp;<b>{{c2::Trochanter}}&nbsp;</b>with/without the <b>Flake</b> of <b>Bone</b> with use of <b>Drill Holes</b> and <b>Large Absorbable</b> or <b>Nonabsorbable Suture</b> to <b>Reattach</b> this <b>Layer </b>of <b>Tendinous</b> Structures <b>Anatomically</b> to the <b>{{c2::Trochanter}}
</b><br><br></div>
<div>The {{c3::<b>IT Band</b>}} and {{c3::<b>Gluteus Maximus/Fascia Lata</b>}} <b>Interval</b> are <b>Closed</b>, and the <b>Subcutaneous Tissue</b>
and <b>Skin </b>are <b>Closed </b>in the<b> Normal</b> fashion&nbsp;</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>

What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Posterior (Judet) Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Scapula</b>?<br><br>1. <b>Incise</b> through <b>Skin</b> and<b> Fat</b><br>2. <b>Identify</b> and <b>Expose</b> the <b>{{c1::Posterior Deltoid}} Muscle</b> Belly<br>3. <b>Sharply</b> Dissect <b>{{c2::Deltoid}}</b> muscle <b>Origin</b> off the {{c2::<b>Scapular Spine</b>}} and {{c2::<b>Base</b> of <b>Acromion</b>}}&nbsp;<br>4. <b>Retract</b> Muscle <b>{{c3::Distal}}</b>&nbsp;and <b>{{c3::Lateral}}</b> to Reveal the <b>Underlying {{c3::Infraspinatus}}&nbsp;</b>and <b>{{c3::Teres Minor}}</b>&nbsp;muscles	"<a href=""https://vimeo.com/246339457"">Vimeo: Posterior Scapula Approaches - What are the <b>4 Variables</b> the <b>Paprosky</b> Classification of <b><u>Acetabular</u></b> <b>Bone Loss</b> is <b>Based</b> Upon?<br><br>{{c1::Location or Migration of the <u>Hip Center of Rotation</u> in Reference to the <u>Superior Obturator Line</u>}}<br>{{c1::Degree of <u>Teardrop Destruction</u>}}<br>{{c1::Amount of <u>Ischial Osteolysis</u>}}<br>{{c1::Integrity of the <u>Kohler Line</u> (ie, Ilioischial line)}}	"<div>Facilitates <b>Objective Assessment</b> of <b>Bone Loss</b> involving the <b>Superior Dome</b>, <b>Medial Acetabular Wall</b>, and<b> Posterior Column</b>.<br><br><img src=""34455-galleyfig1.jpeg""><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 2.57.58 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 2.59.07 AM.png""><br></div>"			"Paprosky I:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 1 acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 351px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIA:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 2a acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 293px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIB:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky iib acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 229px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIC:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 2c acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 319px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIIA:&nbsp;<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky iiia acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 343px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIIB:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 3b acetabulum.jpg"">"					"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/5009/tha-revision"">Orthobullets: THA Revision</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Hip::RevisionTechniques::Revision"

What is the <b>General Treatment </b>for <b>Paprosky </b>Type <b>I Acetabular</b> Defects?<br><br>{{c1::Standard Revision Components or with Cemented or Noncemented <u>Hemispherical Cups</u>}}	"<div>Type I Paprosky defects are characterized by <b>Minimal Bone Loss</b>, with the <b>Superior</b> and <b>Medial Walls</b> of the Acetabulum remaining <b>Intact</b>. The <b>Hip Center </b>of <b>Rotation</b> is within <b>5 mm </b>of the <b>Superior Obturator Line</b>, and there is <b>NO Teardrop</b> or <b>Ischial Osteolysis</b>.<br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 2.57.58 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 2.59.07 AM.png""><br></div>"			"Paprosky I:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 1 acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 351px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIA:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 2a acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 293px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIB:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky iib acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 229px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIC:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 2c acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 319px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIIA:&nbsp;<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky iiia acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 343px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIIB:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 3b acetabulum.jpg"">"					"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/5009/tha-revision"">Orthobullets: THA Revision</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Hip::RevisionTechniques::Revision"
What is the <b>General Treatment </b>for <b>Paprosky </b>Type <b>IIA Acetabular</b> Defects?<br><br>{{c1::Cemented or Noncemented <u>Hemispherical Cup</u> with <u>Screws</u> for Initial Stability or with a <u>Trabecular Metal Cup</u>}}	"<div>Type <b>IIA </b>Paprosky defects are characterized by <b>MODERATE Bone Loss</b>, with the <b>Superior</b> and <b>Medial Walls</b> of the Acetabulum remaining <b>Intact</b>. The <b>Hip Center </b>of <b>Rotation</b> is within <b>5 mm </b>of the <b>Superior Obturator Line</b>, and there is <b>NO Teardrop</b> or <b>Ischial Osteolysis</b>.<br><br><div>However, there is a <b>Loss</b> of <b>Bone</b> in the <b>Anterior </b>and <b>Posterior Columns</b>, which can <b><u>Compromise Component Stability</u></b>.</div><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 2.57.58 AM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 2.59.07 AM.png""><br></div>"			"Paprosky I:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 1 acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 351px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIA:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 2a acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 293px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIB:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky iib acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 229px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIC:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 2c acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 319px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIIA:&nbsp;<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky iiia acetabulum.jpg"" style=""width: 343px;""><br><br>Paprosky IIIB:<br><img class=""resizer"" src=""paprosky 3b acetabulum.jpg"">"					"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/5009/tha-revision"">Orthobullets: THA Revision</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Hip::RevisionTechniques::Revision"
