What is the <b>Origin</b>&nbsp;and <b>Insertion</b> of the <b>Posterior Oblique</b> Ligament of the <b>Knee</b>?<br><br>Origin: {{c1::ADductor Tubercle}}<br>Insertion: {{c1::Tibia &amp; Posterior Aspect of the Joint Capsule}}	"<a href=""https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0268003320303247#f0005"">Biomechanics of the posterior oblique ligament of the knee</a><br><br>Resists <b>INTERNAL Rotation</b><br>Located at the <b>Posterior 1/3</b> of the <b>Medial Capsular Ligament</b>, attaching <b>Proximally</b> to the <b>ADductor tubercle</b> of the Femur&nbsp;and <b>Distally</b> to the <b>Tibia </b>and <b>Posterior </b>aspect of the<b>&nbsp;Joint Capsule</b><br><br><img src=""1-s2.0-S0268003320303247-gr1_lrg.jpg""><br><img src=""1-s2.0-S0268003320303247-gr2_lrg.jpg"">"								"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/5015/tka-coronal-plane-balancing?section=bullets"">Orthobullets: TKA Coronal Plane Balancing</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Knee::TKA_Primary::Coronal_Plane_Balancing"
Why are Patients with <b>Pseudotumor</b> in <b>Metal-on-Metal </b>THA at Higher <b>Risk </b>of <b>Instability</b> Following <b>Revision</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Pseudotumor leads to Significant Soft Tissue Damage, which can Cause ABductor INSUFFICIENCY}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-06-16 at 1.01.54 PM.png""><br><img src=""mom_hip.jpg"">"								"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/422822/tha-pseudotumor-metal-on-metal-reactions?hideLeftMenu=true"">Orthobullets: Pseudotumor</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Hip::Chronic_Complications::Pseudotumor"
What <b>Type</b> of <b>Acetabular Liner</b> has been shown to Lead to <b>Early Acetabular Component Loosening</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Lateralized Offset Liner}}	"Lateralized:<br><img src=""lateralized.jpg""><br><br>Oblique / Face-Changing:<br><img src=""oblique-f01086297337779147381a3847b206576f53caae.jpg""><br><br>Elevated Rim / Lipped:<br><img src=""elevated_rim.jpg""><br><br>Standard Offset Liner:<br><img src=""standard.jpg"">"								"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/422822/tha-pseudotumor-metal-on-metal-reactions?hideLeftMenu=true"">Orthobullets: Pseudotumor</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Hip::PrimaryTHA::Stability"
In which <b>Direction </b>do THA <b>Femoral Components</b> generally <b>Subside</b>? How does this <b>Present </b>on <b>Exam</b>?<br><br>{{c1::Retroversion - External Rotation of Affected Extremity}}	"<img src=""Screen Shot 2023-06-16 at 5.10.46 PM.png""><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-06-16 at 5.14.12 PM.png"">"								"<a href=""https://www.orthobullets.com/recon/5009/tha-revision"">Orthobullets: THA Revision</a>"		"#Ortho::Orthobullets::Recon::Hip::RevisionTechniques::Revision"

What is the&nbsp;<b>Superficial Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral (Watson-Jones)</b><b>&nbsp;Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br>1. Incise <b>{{c1::Fat}}</b> in <b>Line </b>with <b>Incision </b>and&nbsp;<b>Clear {{c1::Fascia Lata}}</b><br>2. Incise <b>Fascia</b>:<br>- Incise in <b>Direction</b> of <b>{{c2::Fibers}}</b>, this will be more <b>Anterior</b> as your <b>Dissect {{c2::Proximal}}ly</b><br>- Incise at the <b>{{c2::Posterior}} Border</b> of the <b>Greater Trochanter</b><br>3. <b>Develop Interval&nbsp;</b>between <b>{{c3::TFL}}</b> and<b> {{c3::Gluteus Medius}}</b><br>- There will be a<b> Small Series</b> of <b>{{c3::Vessels}}</b> in this <b>Interval</b><br>4. <b>{{c4::Externally Rotate::Action?}}</b>&nbsp;the<b> Hip</b> to put the <b>Capsule</b> on <b>Stretch</b><br>5. <b>Identify Origin</b> of <b>{{c5::Vastus Lateralis}}</b>	"<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXa0O1USwy4&amp;ab_channel=AONorthAmerica"">Watson-Jones Approach Video</a><br><br><img src=""Screen Shot 2023-06-17 at What is the&nbsp;<b>DEEP Surgical Dissection</b>&nbsp;used<b>&nbsp;</b>during&nbsp;the&nbsp;<b>Anterolateral (Watson-Jones)</b><b>&nbsp;Approach</b>&nbsp;to the&nbsp;<b>Hip</b>?<br><br>1. <b>Detach ABductor</b> Mechanism&nbsp;by 1 of 2 Mechanisms:<br>1a. <b>Trochanteric Osteotomy</b><br>- <b>Distal Osteotomy site</b> is just<b> Proximal</b> to {{c1::Vastus Lateralis Ridge}}<br>1b. <b>Partial Detachment</b> of <b>ABductor</b> Mechanism<br>- Place <b>Stay Suture</b> to prevent<b> Muscle Split</b> and Damage to <b>{{c2::Superior Gluteal}}&nbsp;nerve</b><br>- Nerve is <b>5 cm</b> <b>Proximal</b> to the <b>{{c2::Acetabular Rim}}</b><br>2. Expose <b>{{c3::Anterior}} Joint Capsule</b><br>3. <b>Detach</b> <b>{{c4::Reflected}} Head</b> of <b>Rectus Femoris</b>&nbsp;from the {{c4::Joint Capsule}} to Expose the <b>Anterior Rim</b>&nbsp;of the <b>Acetabulum</b><br>- Easier with<b> Leg {{c4::Flexed}}</b> Slightly<br>4. <b>Elevate</b> part of the&nbsp;<b>{{c5::Psoas}} Tendon</b>&nbsp;from the <b>Capsule</b><br>5. Perform <b>Anterior Capsulotomy</b><br>6. Dislocate Hip&nbsp;with <b>{{c6::External Rotation::Action}}</b>	"<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXa0O1USwy4&amp;ab_channel=AONorthAmerica"">Watson-Jones Approach Video</a><br><br><img What are the <b>Nonoperative Treatment </b>Modalities for <b>Knee Osteoarthritis Supported</b> by the <b>Literature</b>?
